translated: Therefore, how can the absence of the counter-pervasion be uncertain?

original: de yod na zhes bya ba me yod pa nyid la du ba yod do zhes de ltar ldog pa yang mi nges te /
analyzed: de yod na zhes bya ba me yod pa nyid la du ba yod do zhes de ltar ldog pa yang mi nges te /
translated: Even though the counter-pervasion is stated as ‚Äúif that exists, then this exists,‚Äù i.e., ‚Äúif fire exists, then smoke exists,‚Äù it is still uncertain.

original: rjes su 'gro ba 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad pa'o //üîΩci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad pa'o // ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: It is not only the forward pervasion that is uncertain.üîΩWhy?

original: ma mthong la yang zhes bya ba'o //üîΩrig pa can khyed kyi'o //
analyzed: ma mthong la yang zhes bya ba'o // rig pa can khyed kyi'o //
translated: Because it is not seen in the absence of the reason.üîΩThis is the view of the NaiyƒÅyikas.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni du ba bzhin du 'bras bu nyid kyis gtan tshigs go bar byed pa yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de ltar ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni du ba bzhin du 'bras bu nyid kyis gtan tshigs go bar byed pa yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de ltar ro //
translated: In this way, the effect itself is the proof, just like smoke, and not anything else.

original: khyed nyid rjes su 'dzin pa yin gyi /
analyzed: khyed nyid rjes su 'dzin pa yin gyi /
translated: You yourself are the one who is being cared for.

original: gnyis med par smra ba sangs rgyas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyis med par smra ba sangs rgyas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: You are not a Buddhist who advocates non-duality.

original: gal te rang rjes su 'dzin pa yin yang mi 'dod na de'i tshe rnam pa thams cad du khyed nyid la gnod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te rang rjes su 'dzin pa yin yang mi 'dod na de'i tshe rnam pa thams cad du khyed nyid la gnod par 'gyur te /
translated: If you do not accept even though you are being cared for, then in every way you yourself are harmed,

original: bdag rjes su dpog pa yang med par thal ba'i phyir dang gnyis med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag rjes su dpog pa yang med par thal ba'i phyir dang gnyis med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it follows that the self is not inferred and it follows that it is non-dual.

original: 'chad ba ni khyed kyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'chad ba ni khyed kyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The ‚Äúyou‚Äù is the one who is speaking.

original: gtan tshigs ni srog la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ni srog la sogs pa'o //
translated: The reason is ‚Äúlife-force‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni du ba ltar 'bras bu nyid kyis so//
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni du ba ltar 'bras bu nyid kyis so//
translated: ‚ÄúIn this way‚Äù means by the effect itself, like smoke.

original: rnam pa gzhan du zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu nyid ma yin na /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu nyid ma yin na /
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means if it is not the effect.

original: go bar byed pa nyid mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin na'o //
analyzed: go bar byed pa nyid mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin na'o //
translated: It is taught that it is impossible for it to be the comprehender.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba de'i 'bras bu nyid kyis go bar byed pa nyid du mi 'dod na de'i tshe de'i 'bras bu nyid la rten gzhan tshol cig / rten gzhan ni srid pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba de'i 'bras bu nyid kyis go bar byed pa nyid du mi 'dod na de'i tshe de'i 'bras bu nyid la rten gzhan tshol cig / rten gzhan ni srid pa yang ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúIn this way‚Äù means if you do not assert that it is the comprehender by being the effect of that, then at that time, seek another basis for its being the effect. It is not possible for there to be another basis.

original: gsal zhing 'dzin pa dang 'dra ba ni du ba me'i 'bras bu nyid yin par 'khrul par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: gsal zhing 'dzin pa dang 'dra ba ni du ba me'i 'bras bu nyid yin par 'khrul par brjod pa'o //
translated: The clear and similar apprehension is said to be the error that smoke is the effect of fire.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po khas ma blangs par 'di skad brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po khas ma blangs par 'di skad brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is said without accepting the relation of cause and effect.

original: da ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa grub pa'i don du kun rdzob tu rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po bsgrub pa ni /
analyzed: da ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa grub pa'i don du kun rdzob tu rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po bsgrub pa ni /
translated: Now, in order to establish the reversal from the discordant side, the existence of cause and effect is established conventionally.

original: gzhan yang @192b zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde med pas zhes bya ba ni me med pas du ba 'di med la /
analyzed: gzhan yang @192b zhes bya ba'o // de med pas zhes bya ba ni me med pas du ba 'di med la /
translated: Moreover, if it does not exist, how could it be?

original: med par ci ltar 'gyur /üîΩde ma thag tu zhes bya ba du ba me'i de ma thag tu mi 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: med par ci ltar 'gyur / de ma thag tu zhes bya ba du ba me'i de ma thag tu mi 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: If it does not exist, how could it be?üîΩIf it does not exist, how could it be?üîΩIf it does not exist, how could it be?üîΩIf it does not exist, how could it be?

original: gang gi tshe gnyis po 'dir mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe gnyis po 'dir mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it does not exist, how could it be?

original: gal te sha za la sogs pa gzhan yang rgyu yin na'o //üîΩmthun ba'i zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //üîΩde zhes bya ba ni du ba la sogs pa 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: gal te sha za la sogs pa gzhan yang rgyu yin na'o // mthun ba'i zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o // de zhes bya ba ni du ba la sogs pa 'bras bu'o //
translated: If it does not exist, how could it be?üîΩIf it does not exist, how could it be?üîΩIf it does not exist, how could it be?üîΩIf it does not exist, how could it be?

original: de med na ni zhes bya ba me med na ni de ma thag tu med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'dir ni srid ba ma yin no //üîΩgang gi tshe zhe na sha za la sogs pa gzhan zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de med na ni zhes bya ba me med na ni de ma thag tu med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'dir ni srid ba ma yin no //üîΩgang gi tshe zhe na sha za la sogs pa gzhan zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it does not exist, how could it be?üîΩIf it does not exist, how could it be?üîΩIf it does not exist, how could it be?üîΩIf it does not exist, how could it be?üîΩIf it does not exist, how could it be?üîΩIf it does not exist, how could it be?üîΩIf it does not exist, how could it be?üîΩIf it does not exist, how could it be?üîΩIf it does not exist, how could it be?üîΩIf it does not exist, how could it be?üîΩIf it does not exist, how could it be?üîΩIf it does not exist, how could it be?üîΩIf it does not exist, how could it be?üîΩIf it does not exist, how could it be?

original: dbang du byas pa zhes bya ba ni me'i rjes su 'gro ldog gi rjes su byed ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang du byas pa zhes bya ba ni me'i rjes su 'gro ldog gi rjes su byed ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIn terms of power‚Äù means that it follows the forward and reverse sequences of fire and fuel.

original: 'dod rgyal ba'i zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dod rgyal ba'i zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúArbitrary‚Äù means

original: rgyu mtshan med par du ba las me thob pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan med par du ba las me thob pa'o //
translated: that fire is obtained from smoke without a reason.

original: gtan tshigs de'i phyir byang grol la sogs pa'i sgrub byed thabs tshol ba 'bras bu dang 'bras bu la nges pa'i 'bras bu la so sor nges pa der mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs de'i phyir byang grol la sogs pa'i sgrub byed thabs tshol ba 'bras bu dang 'bras bu la nges pa'i 'bras bu la so sor nges pa der mi 'gyur ro //
translated: For that reason, the search for a means to accomplish liberation and so on would not be definite with regard to its result, and the result would not be definite with regard to its cause.

original: 'o na khyed kyi ltar na rnam pa thams cad du rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po med pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: 'o na khyed kyi ltar na rnam pa thams cad du rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po med pa'i phyir na /
translated: Well, according to you, since the nature of cause and effect does not exist in any way,

original: 'bras bu so so la nges pa'i thabs tshol bar ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu so so la nges pa'i thabs tshol bar ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: how could there be a search for a means that is definite with regard to its result?

original: gnyis su med par zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gnyis su med par zhes gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúNondual‚Äù is stated.

original: kun rdzob tu ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yod pa kho na ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yod pa kho na ste /
translated: In the relative, the nature of cause and effect does exist.

original: des na so sor nges pas 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: des na so sor nges pas 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is engagement through being definite with regard to its result.

original: gang gi phyir rgyu gzhan yod na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyu gzhan yod na /
translated: Since the cause exists,

original: de med pas med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / 'bras bu so so la nges pa'i thabs tshol ba mi 'thad pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med pas med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / 'bras bu so so la nges pa'i thabs tshol ba mi 'thad pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Since that is not tenable, the method of determining the individual results is not tenable.

original: de lta yin mod de lta na yang srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid ci ltar ldog pa can ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: de lta yin mod de lta na yang srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid ci ltar ldog pa can ma yin zhe na /
translated: Even though that is so, how is it that the existence of life-force, etc. is not a universal?

original: gang gi phyir zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes gsungs so //
translated: In response, it is said, ‚Äúbecause . . . ‚Äù

original: ldog pa zhes bya ba ni sha ba dang du ba dag go //üîΩbdag ni gtan tshigs srog la sogs pa la ltos te /
analyzed: ldog pa zhes bya ba ni sha ba dang du ba dag go // bdag ni gtan tshigs srog la sogs pa la ltos te /
translated: ‚ÄúUniversal‚Äù refers to a cow and smoke.

original: rang gi bdag nyid dam rgyu'i dngos por grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid dam rgyu'i dngos por grub pa ma yin no //
translated: The self is not established as its own nature or as a cause in dependence on life-force, etc.

original: de'i phyir na zhes bya ba ni rang gi bdag nyid la sogs pa ma grub bas na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir na zhes bya ba ni rang gi bdag nyid la sogs pa ma grub bas na'o //
translated: Therefore, because its own nature, etc. are not established,

original: khyad par thun mong ma yin pa la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gnyi ga med do //
analyzed: khyad par thun mong ma yin pa la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gnyi ga med do //
translated: there is neither positive nor negative concomitance with a unique particular.

original: ci'i phyir de kho na bzhin du ldog pa can nyid du 'grub ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de kho na bzhin du ldog pa can nyid du 'grub ce na /
translated: Why is it established as a universal in that way?

original: de'i bdag nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: It is said, ‚Äúbecause it is not of the nature of that . . . ‚Äù

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i bdag nyid la nges ba kho na de med pas ldog pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i bdag nyid la nges ba kho na de med pas ldog pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the object to be established is only that which is absent, since it is absent in the nature of the other.

original: ci'i phyir de kho na de ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de kho na de ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why is that so?

original: 'brel pa med pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning is that it is not related.

original: de lta yin dang zhes bya ba @193a * //
analyzed: de lta yin dang zhes bya ba @193a * //
translated: If that is so,

original: ni 'brel pa dang ldan pa kho na ldog par byed pa yin dang ngo //
analyzed: ni 'brel pa dang ldan pa kho na ldog par byed pa yin dang ngo //
translated: the meaning is that only that which is related is the object of negation.

original: ci ltar gtan tshigs ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar gtan tshigs ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it not a reason?

original: ma 'brel ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma 'brel ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning is that it is not related.

original: 'on te grog la sogs pa ni bdag la 'brel ba kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te grog la sogs pa ni bdag la 'brel ba kho na'o zhe na /
translated: But if the ant-hill and so on are related to the self,

original: 'brel pa dang ldan ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa dang ldan ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the meaning is that it is related.

original: 'o na ldan ba can la sogs pa'i 'brel pa las khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po yin pa kho na'o zhes na /
analyzed: 'o na ldan ba can la sogs pa'i 'brel pa las khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po yin pa kho na'o zhes na /
translated: But if the relation of inherence and so on is the relation of the pervader and the pervaded,

original: de'i bdag nyid dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the meaning is that it is of the same nature.

original: dogs pa bsu ba ni ldan pa can la sogs pa rnam ba gzhan gyis kyang ci ste khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: dogs pa bsu ba ni ldan pa can la sogs pa rnam ba gzhan gyis kyang ci ste khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po ma yin zhe na /
translated: Anticipating an objection, [the root text] states, ‚ÄúWhy is it not the case that the state of being an endurer, etc., is also the relation of the qualifier and the qualified?‚Äù

original: 'on te rnam pa gzhan gyis khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te rnam pa gzhan gyis khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: [The root text] responds, ‚ÄúIt is not the relation of the qualifier and the qualified in any other way.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba las ma gtogs pa khyab bar bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i rgyu mtshan rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgal te de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba kho nas /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba las ma gtogs pa khyab bar bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i rgyu mtshan rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro // gal te de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba kho nas /
translated: Because, apart from being of the same nature and arising from it, there is no other reason for the relation of the qualifier and the qualified.

original: srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid go bar byed pa yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid go bar byed pa yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that the state of being an endurer, etc., is understood only through being of the same nature and arising from it,

original: rnam pa de nyid kyang zhes bya ba ste de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rnam pa de nyid kyang zhes bya ba ste de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: [the root text] responds, ‚ÄúThat very form,‚Äù that is, the form of being of the same nature and arising from it,

original: srog la sogs pa la ni de ltar yang ste rtogs par yang ma gyur te /
analyzed: srog la sogs pa la ni de ltar yang ste rtogs par yang ma gyur te /
translated: ‚Äúis not understood in the case of life, etc.‚Äù

original: srog la sogs pa bdag la de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba nyid du rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa bdag la de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba nyid du rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that life and so on are not understood to be of the nature of the self or to arise from it.

original: des zhes bya ba ni rang gi bdag nyid la sogs par ma grub pas na'o //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni rang gi bdag nyid la sogs par ma grub pas na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that‚Äù means by not being established as one‚Äôs own nature and so on.

original: des kyang ni slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos kyang ngo //
analyzed: des kyang ni slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos kyang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that‚Äù means by the master DignƒÅga.

original: 'di nyid ces bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid ces bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis very thing‚Äù is the absence of positive and negative concomitance.

original: tshig rkang bzhi pa 'grel ba ni /
analyzed: tshig rkang bzhi pa 'grel ba ni /
translated: The commentary on the four lines is as follows.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf that were not so‚Äù is the commentary.

original: de lta na yang zhes bya ba ni go bar byed pa yin na yang ngo ;
analyzed: de lta na yang zhes bya ba ni go bar byed pa yin na yang ngo ;
translated: ‚ÄúEven so‚Äù is the commentary on ‚Äúeven if it is an illuminator.‚Äù

original: / de'i phyir na ma nges pa zhes bya ba rnam par 'grel ba ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: / de'i phyir na ma nges pa zhes bya ba rnam par 'grel ba ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore it is inconclusive‚Äù is the commentary on ‚Äútherefore.‚Äù

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù is the nonexistence of life and so on.üîΩ‚ÄúFor that reason‚Äù is the commentary on ‚Äúfor that reason.‚Äù

original: gtan tshigs de'i phyir gson po'i lus la yang /
analyzed: gtan tshigs de'i phyir gson po'i lus la yang /
translated: ‚ÄúIn the living body‚Äù is the commentary on ‚Äúin the living body.‚Äù

original: khyab par bya ba bdag ldog pa yod na gdon mi zab bar khyab par byed srog la sogs pa med pa nyid kyang yod bar 'gyur ba zhig / yod pa yang ma yin te de'i phyir khyab par byed pa srog la sogs pa log pas khyab par bya
analyzed: khyab par bya ba bdag ldog pa yod na gdon mi zab bar khyab par byed srog la sogs pa med pa nyid kyang yod bar 'gyur ba zhig / yod pa yang ma yin te de'i phyir khyab par byed pa srog la sogs pa log pas khyab par bya
translated: But that is not the case, and therefore, since the pervader, life force and so on, is negated, the pervaded, the self, is not negated.

original: ba bdag med pa ldog bas na bdag rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa rjes su brjod nas lan 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: ba bdag med pa ldog bas na bdag rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa rjes su brjod nas lan 'debs pa ni /
translated: Having thus restated the opponent‚Äôs argument, Chandrakƒ´rti replies:

original: srog la sogs ba med ba bdag med pa'i khyab par byed pa nyid @193b yin pa de yang mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyab pa med par mi 'grub po //
analyzed: srog la sogs ba med ba bdag med pa'i khyab par byed pa nyid @193b yin pa de yang mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyab pa med par mi 'grub po //
translated: The absence of life force and so on is not established as the pervader of the absence of self in a way that is concordant with the predicate.üîΩIf the pervader were established without relying on the pervaded, then the self would be established because the pervader, the absence of life force and so on, would be negated by the negation of the pervaded, the absence of self.

original: rjes su 'gro ba la mi ltos par khyab bar byed ba nyid grub ba yin na ni de log bas bdag med ba ldog pa'i phyir bdag rtogs bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes brjod pa ni gal te mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag ces bya ba ste srog la
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba la mi ltos par khyab bar byed ba nyid grub ba yin na ni de log bas bdag med ba ldog pa'i phyir bdag rtogs bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes brjod pa ni gal te mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag ces bya ba ste srog la
translated: The opponent says: If the absence of life force and so on is not established as the pervader of the absence of self in a way that is concordant with the predicate, then the absence of self is not established as the pervader of the absence of life force and so on in a way that is concordant with the predicate.

original: sogs pa med pa dang ; bdag med pa dag go //
analyzed: sogs pa med pa dang ; bdag med pa dag go //
translated: and the absence of self.

original: rjes su 'gro ba med par zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa bdag la 'brel pa ma yin yang ngo //üîΩ'o na khyab pa de grub pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med par zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa bdag la 'brel pa ma yin yang ngo // 'o na khyab pa de grub pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: The absence of concomitance is that life force, etc. are not related to the self.üîΩIf you say that the pervasion is established,

original: mi mthun ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi mthun ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then it is not the case that the pervasion is not established.

original: ci'i phyir mi 'grub snyam na /üîΩbdag dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi 'grub snyam na / bdag dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Why is it not established?üîΩThe self is not the cause of the cessation of life force, etc.

original: bdag ldog par byed ba nyid ma yin mod de lta na yang bdag ldog pa la ni srog la sogs pa ldog pas khyab pa 'grub po zhe na /
analyzed: bdag ldog par byed ba nyid ma yin mod de lta na yang bdag ldog pa la ni srog la sogs pa ldog pas khyab pa 'grub po zhe na /
translated: Even though the self is not the cause of the cessation of life force, etc., the pervasion of the cessation of life force, etc. by the cessation of the self is established.

original: ldog par byed pa ma yin pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: ldog par byed pa ma yin pa zhes smos so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is not the case that the pervasion is not established‚Äù is stated.

original: gang gi phyir mthun phyogs kyi khyab pa med par ldog pa'i khyab pa mi 'grub pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mthun phyogs kyi khyab pa med par ldog pa'i khyab pa mi 'grub pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the pervasion of the counter-pervasion is not established without the pervasion of the similar instance.

original: ci ltar na srog la sogs pa med ba'i khyab byed nyid du mi 'grub ce na /
analyzed: ci ltar na srog la sogs pa med ba'i khyab byed nyid du mi 'grub ce na /
translated: How is it that the pervasion of the absence of life force, etc. is not established?

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ste ma 'brel pa gzhan log pas /
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ste ma 'brel pa gzhan log pas /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe cessation of the other‚Äù means the cessation of the unrelated other.

original: 'bral zla ma yin pa gzhan ldog pa ni mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bral zla ma yin pa gzhan ldog pa ni mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable that the other, which is not a disjunction, is a disjunction.

original: gal te ci ltar mi rung zhes gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te ci ltar mi rung zhes gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúWhy is it not tenable?‚Äù

original: 'brel ba yod par dogs pa ni de bdag ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'brel ba yod par dogs pa ni de bdag ces bya ba'o //
translated: The doubt that there is a connection is ‚Äúthat self.‚Äù

original: ci ste zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: ci ste zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù is the explanation.

original: rig byed kyi mthar smra ba rnams kyi ltar na ni /
analyzed: rig byed kyi mthar smra ba rnams kyi ltar na ni /
translated: According to the VedƒÅntins,

original: srog la sogs pa bdag gi rang bzhin yin te des na rnam 'grel du de'i sgras bdag bzung ba yin la bdag gi sgras ni rang bzhin bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa bdag gi rang bzhin yin te des na rnam 'grel du de'i sgras bdag bzung ba yin la bdag gi sgras ni rang bzhin bzung ba yin no //
translated: life force and so on are the nature of the self. Therefore in the Commentary the term ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to the self, and the term ‚Äúits‚Äù refers to its nature.

original: de'i bdag ste rang bzhin ga la yod pa de la de skad ces tshig sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i bdag ste rang bzhin ga la yod pa de la de skad ces tshig sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúHow could that self have a nature?‚Äù The phrase is constructed in this way.

original: bdag dmigs pa na srog la sogs pa de dmigs la /
analyzed: bdag dmigs pa na srog la sogs pa de dmigs la /
translated: When the self is observed, that life force and so on is observed.

original: bdag rtogs pa med na yang mig la sogs pa de ma rtogs na bdag gi rang bzhin dang / bdag las byung ba nyid 'di grub bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag rtogs pa med na yang mig la sogs pa de ma rtogs na bdag gi rang bzhin dang / bdag las byung ba nyid 'di grub bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if the self is not realized, if that eye and so on is not realized, then the nature of the self and the arising of the self are established.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù is the explanation.

original: de'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag gi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag gi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the characteristic of the self.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa yang ngo //
translated: Moreover, means also life-force, etc.

original: de'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni bdag gi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni bdag gi rang bzhin no //
translated: Its nature means the nature of the self.

original: de nyid ni bdag go //
analyzed: de nyid ni bdag go //
translated: That itself is the self.

original: 'du ba yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de las byung ba'i phyogs su ni 'byin par byed do //
analyzed: 'du ba yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de las byung ba'i phyogs su ni 'byin par byed do //
translated: In the section on arising from that, he says, ‚ÄúThe collection, etc.‚Äù

original: mjug sdud ba ni de'i phyir de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung bar ci ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mjug sdud ba ni de'i phyir de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung bar ci ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The summary is, ‚ÄúTherefore, how could it be of the nature of that or arise from that?‚Äù

original: mthong dang ma mthong zhes bya ba ni yul can gyi yul bstan @194a * //üîΩpa'i phyir na /
analyzed: mthong dang ma mthong zhes bya ba ni yul can gyi yul bstan @194a * // pa'i phyir na /
translated: Seen and unseen means that the object of the subject is taught.

original: rgyu dang khyab byed nyid du sgrub par byed pa rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang khyab byed nyid du sgrub par byed pa rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag ma grub pa'o //
translated: The proof of cause and pervasion are not established in terms of the forward and reverse pervasion.

original: gal te bum pa la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gal te bum pa la sogs pa la /
translated: If it is said that the self is the nature of the aggregates,

original: bdag shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag dang ma grub pa de lta na yang ldog pa ni grub pa kho na yin la de grub na yang srog la sogs pa yang ldog pa'i phyir khyab pa 'grub pa ci ste ma
analyzed: bdag shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag dang ma grub pa de lta na yang ldog pa ni grub pa kho na yin la de grub na yang srog la sogs pa yang ldog pa'i phyir khyab pa 'grub pa ci ste ma
translated: Even though the self is not established as the object of the operation of the reason, i.e., as the reverse pervasion, still, the reverse pervasion is established, and when that is established, then life force, etc., are also reversed, so why is the pervasion not established?

original: yin zhe na /
analyzed: yin zhe na /
translated: What is not so?

original: bum pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is a pot, etc.

original: ci ltar ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it not so?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is like this.

original: bdag shin tu lkog tu gyur pa na ni ma dmigs pa las med pa mi rtogs so //
analyzed: bdag shin tu lkog tu gyur pa na ni ma dmigs pa las med pa mi rtogs so //
translated: When the self is extremely hidden, non-apprehension does not ascertain its non-existence.

original: des na bum pa la sogs pa la bdag med par grub pa med pa na /
analyzed: des na bum pa la sogs pa la bdag med par grub pa med pa na /
translated: Therefore, when the non-existence of the self in pots, etc. is not established,

original: bdag de'i srog la sogs pa'i khyab par byed pa nyid ci ltar rtogs /
analyzed: bdag de'i srog la sogs pa'i khyab par byed pa nyid ci ltar rtogs /
translated: how can the pervasion of the self by life force, etc. be ascertained?

original: 'o na ni gang la rgyu dang khyab par byed pa sgrub par byed pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa yod ce na dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'o na ni gang la rgyu dang khyab par byed pa sgrub par byed pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa yod ce na dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis zhes smos so //
translated: If you say that the pervasion is established by the reason of the nature of the object, then what is the object whose cause and pervader are established by the reason of the nature of the object?

original: des na zhes bya ba ni dmigs par bya ba ma yin pas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni dmigs par bya ba ma yin pas na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means because it is not an object of apprehension.

original: de ma yin na yang zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang khyab par byed pa nyid ma yin na yang ngo //
analyzed: de ma yin na yang zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang khyab par byed pa nyid ma yin na yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúEven if it is not‚Äù means even if it is not a cause or a pervader.

original: yul lam dus gzhan 'ga' la yang mthong ba med pa'i ngo bo can sha za la sogs pa dang 'dra ba gang yin pa de bum pa la sogs pa la med ces bya ba de lta bu'i dngos po med pa nyid du nges par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul lam dus gzhan 'ga' la yang mthong ba med pa'i ngo bo can sha za la sogs pa dang 'dra ba gang yin pa de bum pa la sogs pa la med ces bya ba de lta bu'i dngos po med pa nyid du nges par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not seen anywhere else, in another place or time, it is like a ghost, and it cannot be ascertained that such a thing does not exist in a pot, etc.

original: des na ldog pa shes pa med pa'i bdag gi srog la sogs pa med pa ldog pa srog la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid la khyab par byed pa yin pa yang ci ltar 'gyur /üîΩgang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pas phyed snga ma ldog pa'i sgo nas bshad nas /
analyzed: des na ldog pa shes pa med pa'i bdag gi srog la sogs pa med pa ldog pa srog la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid la khyab par byed pa yin pa yang ci ltar 'gyur / gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pas phyed snga ma ldog pa'i sgo nas bshad nas /
translated: Therefore, how could the absence of a self, life-force, etc., which is not known through a negative example, be a pervader of the negation of a life-force, etc.?

original: rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas 'chad pa ni /
translated: The first half of the verse is explained through a negative example, beginning with ‚ÄúWhatever is . . .‚ÄùüîΩThe second half is explained through a positive example, beginning with ‚ÄúWhatever is . . .‚Äù

original: gang zhig nam yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig nam yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhatever is . . . never‚Äù is the positive example.

original: 'di nyid brjod pa ni mthong pa med pa la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid brjod pa ni mthong pa med pa la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is being said: ‚Äúnon-seeing‚Äù is the non-seeing of the object of negation.

original: rtogs pa yod dam med ces bya bar 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa yod dam med ces bya bar 'jug pa'o //
translated: The question is whether or not there is an object of negation.

original: 'o na de'i bdag nyid dgag pa yang mi bya bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de'i bdag nyid dgag pa yang mi bya bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But then, the negation of its nature would not be possible.

original: thams cad la ni zhes bya ba ste mthong ba dang ma mthong ba la ltos nas so //
analyzed: thams cad la ni zhes bya ba ste mthong ba dang ma mthong ba la ltos nas so //
translated: ‚Äú In all cases‚Äù means in terms of seeing and not seeing.

original: phyed phyi ma 'chad pa ni de ltar zhes bya ba'o//
analyzed: phyed phyi ma 'chad pa ni de ltar zhes bya ba'o//
translated: The explanation of the second half of the verse begins with ‚ÄúThus, . . . ‚Äù

original: rten pa 'gog pa ni thams cad la ltos pa can ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rten pa 'gog pa ni thams cad la ltos pa can ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: The refutation of the basis is stated as follows: ‚ÄúIn all cases, . . . ‚Äù

original: bum pa la sogs pa la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú In the case of pots, . . . ‚Äù

original: spyi la sogs pa ni bdag dang 'dra bar bltar rung ba ma yin yang ba ltar rung ba nyid du khas blangs pa kho na las rang bzhin mi dmigs pa rten pa nyid 'gog pa yin la gzhan du @194b ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rigsüîΩpa yin no //
analyzed: spyi la sogs pa ni bdag dang 'dra bar bltar rung ba ma yin yang ba ltar rung ba nyid du khas blangs pa kho na las rang bzhin mi dmigs pa rten pa nyid 'gog pa yin la gzhan du @194b ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rigsüîΩpa yin no //
translated: Although universals and so on are not suitable to be seen in the way that the self is, they are accepted as being suitable to be seen. The nonobservation of nature is only the refutation of the basis in this case, and not in any other. This is the principle.

original: 'on te bum pa la sogs pa la bdag gis dben par dmigs pas de med par nges ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te bum pa la sogs pa la bdag gis dben par dmigs pas de med par nges ba yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you think that the pot, etc. are ascertained as nonexistent because they are perceived as devoid of self,

original: des dben bar ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des dben bar ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then it is said, ‚Äúby that, devoid of what?‚Äù

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni bdag med par ro //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni bdag med par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThus‚Äù means as devoid of self.

original: de yang na lus so //
analyzed: de yang na lus so //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the body.

original: des ni bdag gi dben par ro //
analyzed: des ni bdag gi dben par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that‚Äù means by the absence of self in the pot, etc.

original: gang gi phyir dben par dmigs pas bum pa la sogs pa la bdag med par 'grub na lus la yang med par 'grub par 'gyur ba des na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dben par dmigs pas bum pa la sogs pa la bdag med par 'grub na lus la yang med par 'grub par 'gyur ba des na'o //
translated: If the nonexistence of self in the pot, etc. were established by the perception of their absence of self, then the nonexistence of self in the body would also be established.

original: srog la sogs pa med pa ldog pa ni srog la sogs pa yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa med pa ldog pa ni srog la sogs pa yod pa nyid do //
translated: The negation of the nonexistence of life, etc. is the existence of life, etc.

original: ci'i phyir bdag khyab par byed pa nyid ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bdag khyab par byed pa nyid ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is the self not a pervader?

original: brjod pa du ba gang zhig ldog pas /üîΩme gang ldog pa khyab pa du ba ldog pa de ldog pa ni /
analyzed: brjod pa du ba gang zhig ldog pas / me gang ldog pa khyab pa du ba ldog pa de ldog pa ni /
translated: It is said: Whatever is the negation of smoke,üîΩthat is the negation of the pervader, fire. The negation of the negation of smoke

original: me ldog pa ldog pa'i rang bzhin des khyab par 'gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: me ldog pa ldog pa'i rang bzhin des khyab par 'gyur pa yin no //
translated: is the negation of the pervader, fire. By that, it is pervaded.

original: gal te de lta yin du zad mod des cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin du zad mod des cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then what follows from that?

original: bdag ldog pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag ldog pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said: The negation of the self.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ldog pa dag khyab pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ldog pa dag khyab pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, because the exclusions do not pervade.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ni khyab pa 'grub pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ni khyab pa 'grub pa nyid kyis so //
translated: By which, by the establishment of the pervasion.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag ba ltar mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag ba ltar mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, because it is not tenable that the self is like that.

original: 'di la ni bum pa la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: 'di la ni bum pa la sogs pa la'o //
translated: Here, in a pot, etc.

original: srog la sogs pa ni bum pa la sogs ba la yod pa dang med pa nyid du rtogs bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa ni bum pa la sogs ba la yod pa dang med pa nyid du rtogs bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Life, etc. would be understood as existing and not existing in a pot, etc.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: mthong bdag gis te dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa nyid kyi ste /
analyzed: mthong bdag gis te dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa nyid kyi ste /
translated: By seeing, by the characteristic of perception.üîΩNot by mere non-apprehension.

original: mi dmigs pa tsam gyis ni ma yin no de ltar zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa tsam gyis ni ma yin no de ltar zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa bzhin du'o //
translated: Like that, like life, etc.

original: gson po'i lus ma yin pa ni bum pa la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: gson po'i lus ma yin pa ni bum pa la sogs pa la'o //
translated: Not in a living body, in a pot, etc.

original: phyed phyi ma ldog pa'i sgo nas rnam par 'grel ba ni /
analyzed: phyed phyi ma ldog pa'i sgo nas rnam par 'grel ba ni /
translated: The latter half is explained by way of the negation:

original: bdag ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The self, etc.

original: bum ba la sogs pa la ni /
analyzed: bum ba la sogs pa la ni /
translated: In a pot, etc.

original: srog la sogs pa'i ldog par byed pa bdag med pa nyid dang 'brel pa gang yin pa de mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa'i ldog par byed pa bdag med pa nyid dang 'brel pa gang yin pa de mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cessation of life, etc. is related to the absence of self.

original: bdag med par ni ldog par byed pa ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: bdag med par ni ldog par byed pa ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: It is not related to the absence of self.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'bad rtsol la sogs pa gzhan med pa'o //
analyzed: 'bad rtsol la sogs pa gzhan med pa'o //
translated: Because there is no other effort, etc.

original: de med pa zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa med pas so //
analyzed: de med pa zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa med pas so //
translated: The absence of that is the absence of life, etc.

original: 'di ni bum pa la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bum pa la sogs pa la'o //
translated: This is the case with pots, etc.

original: 'on te blo la sogs pa lus la med pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te blo la sogs pa lus la med pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: But if the mind, etc. are not in the body at all,

original: blo la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: blo la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the mind, etc.

original: chos mtshungs pa sangs rgyas pa'i 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: chos mtshungs pa sangs rgyas pa'i 'dod pa yin no //
translated: are similar properties, according to the Buddhist view.

original: gal te blo la sogs pa yod pa dang med pas byas pa'i chos mi mtshungs pa yang yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te blo la sogs pa yod pa dang med pas byas pa'i chos mi mtshungs pa yang yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But aren‚Äôt there also dissimilar properties, which are produced by the existence or nonexistence of the mind, etc.?

original: des na srog la sogs pa dang 'bral bar ci ltar @195a * //üîΩ'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des na srog la sogs pa dang 'bral bar ci ltar @195a * // 'gyur zhe na /
translated: So how can there be a cessation of life, etc.?

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù means ‚Äúif it were to exist.‚Äù

original: gang zhig bdag med pa de ni srog la sogs pa ston ba yin te dper na bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gang zhig bdag med pa de ni srog la sogs pa ston ba yin te dper na bum pa bzhin no //
translated: That which is without self is shown to be without life, etc., as for example, a pot.

original: gson po'i lus kyang bdag med pa yin no //
analyzed: gson po'i lus kyang bdag med pa yin no //
translated: And the living body is without self.

original: des na srog la sogs pas stod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na srog la sogs pas stod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is shown to be without life, etc.

original: thal ba ldog pa brjod pa ni /
analyzed: thal ba ldog pa brjod pa ni /
translated: The reversal of the reductio is:

original: srog la sogs pa med pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa med pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since it is without life, etc.

original: gson po'i lus srog la sogs pa dang ldan par khas len na /
analyzed: gson po'i lus srog la sogs pa dang ldan par khas len na /
translated: If one accepts that the living body has life, etc.,

original: de bdag dang bcas par sangs rgyas pas khas blang bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩtha dad ba yang zhes bya ba ni bum pa las tha dad pa'i lus la yang /
analyzed: de bdag dang bcas par sangs rgyas pas khas blang bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // tha dad ba yang zhes bya ba ni bum pa las tha dad pa'i lus la yang /
translated: then one must accept that it has a self, as the Buddha has said.

original: bdag med ba tsam cung zad chos mthun pas srog la sogs pa dang mi ldan pa der rtogs par byed na'o //
analyzed: bdag med ba tsam cung zad chos mthun pas srog la sogs pa dang mi ldan pa der rtogs par byed na'o //
translated: Also, if different means if one infers that the body, which is different from the pot, is without life, etc., because it is similar to the pot in being merely without self.

original: mi 'dod ce na zhes bya ba ni gzhal bya nyid kyi bum pa la sogs pa bdag dang bcas pa nyid du mi 'dod na'o //
analyzed: mi 'dod ce na zhes bya ba ni gzhal bya nyid kyi bum pa la sogs pa bdag dang bcas pa nyid du mi 'dod na'o //
translated: If one does not accept means if one does not accept that the pot, etc., which are objects of knowledge, have a self.

original: lan ni tshad ma nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni tshad ma nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is: because they are valid cognitions.

original: ci ltar tshad ma nyid 'dod pa'i rgyu mtshan yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar tshad ma nyid 'dod pa'i rgyu mtshan yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it the reason for asserting valid cognition?

original: de med par zhes bya ba chos can tshad ma med par ro //
analyzed: de med par zhes bya ba chos can tshad ma med par ro //
translated: Without that, where that refers to the subject, there is no valid cognition.

original: 'on te bum pa la sogs pa ni bdag dang bcas par mi 'dod de des na med pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te bum pa la sogs pa ni bdag dang bcas par mi 'dod de des na med pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But you do not assert that such things as pots have a self, so they do not exist!

original: tshad mas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshad mas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Valid cognition.

original: zlog par byed ces bya ba ni nye bar mtshon ba ste the tshom du yang 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: zlog par byed ces bya ba ni nye bar mtshon ba ste the tshom du yang 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: To negate is a metaphor; it is not even a doubt.

original: 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: 'di ga las she na /
translated: Why is this?

original: tshad ma ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshad ma ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Valid cognition.

original: de lta ma yin te 'dod pas dngos po dang dngos po med pa 'dor len byed na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te 'dod pas dngos po dang dngos po med pa 'dor len byed na /
translated: Otherwise, if one were to accept or reject existence and nonexistence according to one's wishes,

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa 'dor len byed par mi 'gyur ro zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa 'dor len byed par mi 'gyur ro zhes 'brel to //
translated: one would not accept or reject existence and nonexistence, is the connection.

original: ci ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why would one not?

original: tshad ma las rang dbang med par ro //
analyzed: tshad ma las rang dbang med par ro //
translated: Because one is not independent with regard to valid cognition.

original: ci ltar 'dod pas dngos po dang dngos po med pa 'dor len byed ce na /
analyzed: ci ltar 'dod pas dngos po dang dngos po med pa 'dor len byed ce na /
translated: How does one accept or reject existence and nonexistence according to one's wishes?

original: rgol ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgol ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The opponent is the one who accepts or rejects existence and nonexistence according to his wishes.

original: de'i phyir dngos po dang dngos po med pa ma mchis par gnas ba med de 'chol ba kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po dang dngos po med pa ma mchis par gnas ba med de 'chol ba kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, since neither entity nor nonentity exists, there is no abiding; there is only confusion.

original: 'o na zhes bya ba ni dogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na zhes bya ba ni dogs par byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWell, then‚Äù is a question.

original: srog la sogs pa 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi blo la sogs pa yang bdag la brten pa yin zhes so //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi blo la sogs pa yang bdag la brten pa yin zhes so //
translated: It is not only life, etc., but also cognition, etc., that are based on the self.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni blo la sogs pa bdag la brtan pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni blo la sogs pa bdag la brtan pa nyid kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means because cognition, etc., are based on the self.

original: de med na med pas na'o //
analyzed: de med na med pas na'o //
translated: Since they do not exist when it does not exist.

original: sangs rgyas pas gang brjod pa de'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pas gang brjod pa de'o //
translated: The Buddhists say that.

original: lan ni mi rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni mi rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reply is ‚ÄúIt is not unreasonable.

original: gzhan nyid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan nyid ces bya ba ni /
translated: ‚Äù ‚ÄúDifference‚Äù means

original: mig la sogs pa tshogs pa snga mar gyur pa rnams nyid phyis kyi mig la sogs pa'i tshogs pa de la'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa tshogs pa snga mar gyur pa rnams nyid phyis kyi mig la sogs pa'i tshogs pa de la'o //
translated: that the previous collection of eye, etc., is different from the later collection of eye, etc.

original: 'o na ci ltar blo la sogs pa'i ldog par byed pa bdag @195b yin par rigs she na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar blo la sogs pa'i ldog par byed pa bdag @195b yin par rigs she na /
translated: Well, then, how is it reasonable that the self is the controller of cognition, etc.?

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù means

original: de lta na ni zhes bya ba 'jug par byed pa nyid du nges ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de lta na ni zhes bya ba 'jug par byed pa nyid du nges ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚Äúin that case.‚Äù ‚ÄúIt is not certain‚Äù means that it is not definite that it is the controller.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni dran pa la sogs pa dag ni'o //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni dran pa la sogs pa dag ni'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù refers to memory, etc.

original: de'ang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'ang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to

original: gul dang dbang bo dang blo'o //
analyzed: gul dang dbang bo dang blo'o //
translated: the sense faculty, the object, and the mind.

original: rang gi rigs de nye bar len ba'i rgyu las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: rang gi rigs de nye bar len ba'i rgyu las byung ba yin no //
translated: It arises from the cause that is the appropriator of its own type.

original: rang gi rigs tsam las 'byung bar yang ma zad de /
analyzed: rang gi rigs tsam las 'byung bar yang ma zad de /
translated: Not only does it arise from its own type,

original: phan tshun rkyen la ni ltos pa'i zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: phan tshun rkyen la ni ltos pa'i zhes bya ba ste /
translated: but it also depends on mutual conditions,

original: bdag nyid ci lta ba lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu la yang ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid ci lta ba lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu la yang ltos pa yin no //
translated: as it also depends on the co-operating causes that are like itself.

original: blo drug po 'di rnam las /
analyzed: blo drug po 'di rnam las /
translated: From among these six types of mind,

original: mig la sogs pa'i blo dag la ni de rnam par 'gyur ba'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed par mthong ba las mig la sogs pa'i nus pa 'jug pa yin la /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i blo dag la ni de rnam par 'gyur ba'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed par mthong ba las mig la sogs pa'i nus pa 'jug pa yin la /
translated: the minds of the eye, etc., are seen to follow the arising and ceasing of their respective images, and thus the potency of the eye, etc., is engaged.

original: yid la byed pa'i nus pa ni thams cad la yang 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: yid la byed pa'i nus pa ni thams cad la yang 'jug pa yin te /
translated: The potency of mental activity is engaged in all cases,

original: de mthun pa dang mi mthun pa dang dag las phyis kyi rnam par shes pa mthun pa dang mi mthun par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mthun pa dang mi mthun pa dang dag las phyis kyi rnam par shes pa mthun pa dang mi mthun par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because a subsequent consciousness that is in conformity or not in conformity with the object is seen to arise from a prior consciousness that is in conformity or not in conformity with the object.

original: 'byung ba dang rngub pa dang dbang po la sogs pa rnams kyi nye bar len pa'i rgyu ni skal ba mnyam ba snga ma yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang rngub pa dang dbang po la sogs pa rnams kyi nye bar len pa'i rgyu ni skal ba mnyam ba snga ma yin no //
translated: The homogeneous cause is the cause of the life faculty, of the sense faculties, etc.

original: blo ni rkyen yin no //
analyzed: blo ni rkyen yin no //
translated: The condition is the mind.

original: de dang ba dang rnyog pa dag las dbang po rnams la phan pa dang gnod pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang ba dang rnyog pa dag las dbang po rnams la phan pa dang gnod pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For one sees that the sense faculties are benefited or harmed by the purity or impurity of the mind.üîΩThe entry and the withdrawal of the life faculty, etc., follow upon the mind and upon effort.üîΩThe life faculty, etc., are the effect of the mind, because they arise in dependence upon the mind.

original: srog la sogs pa 'jug pa dang ldog pa dag ni blo dang 'bad rtsol gyi rjes su byed pa yin no //üîΩphan tshun ltos pa'i rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pa de tsam las bdag gi dngos po'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa la brten pa yin te /üîΩmthong ba'i tshogs pa 'di las gzhan du bdag rgyur rtogs na ni gzhan dang gzhan yang brtag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa 'jug pa dang ldog pa dag ni blo dang 'bad rtsol gyi rjes su byed pa yin no // phan tshun ltos pa'i rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pa de tsam las bdag gi dngos po'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa la brten pa yin te / mthong ba'i tshogs pa 'di las gzhan du bdag rgyur rtogs na ni gzhan dang gzhan yang brtag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The life faculty, etc., are the cause of the mind, because they are the basis of the mind.üîΩThe life faculty, etc., are the effect of the mind, because they arise in dependence upon the mind.üîΩThe life faculty, etc., are the cause of the mind, because they are the basis of the mind.üîΩThe life faculty, etc., are the effect of the mind, because they arise in dependence upon the mind.üîΩThe life faculty, etc., are the cause of the mind, because they are the basis of the mind.üîΩThe life faculty, etc., are the effect of the mind, because they arise in dependence upon the mind.üîΩThe life faculty, etc., are the cause of the mind, because they are the basis of the mind.üîΩThe life faculty, etc., are the effect of the mind, because they arise in dependence upon the mind.üîΩThe life faculty, etc., are the cause of the mind, because they are the basis of the mind.üîΩThe life faculty, etc., are the effect of the mind, because they arise in dependence upon the mind.üîΩThe life faculty, etc., are the cause of the mind, because they are the basis of the mind.üîΩThe life faculty, etc., are the effect of the mind, because they arise in dependence upon the mind.üîΩThe life faculty, etc., are the cause of the mind, because they are the basis of the mind.üîΩThe life faculty, etc., are the effect of the mind, because they arise in dependence upon the mind.üîΩThe life faculty, etc., are the cause of the mind, because they are the basis of the mind.üîΩThe life faculty, etc., are the effect of the mind, because they arise in dependence upon the mind.üîΩThe life faculty, etc., are the cause of the mind, because they are the basis of the mind.üîΩThe life faculty, etc., are the effect of the mind, because they arise in dependence upon the mind.

original: de'i phyir nus ba ma mthong ba'i bdag log pas srog la sogs pa log par ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir nus ba ma mthong ba'i bdag log pas srog la sogs pa log par ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: The life faculty, etc., are

original: mi 'dod pa'am zhes bya ba ni dri la sogs pa mthong ba la'o //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa'am zhes bya ba ni dri la sogs pa mthong ba la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot desired‚Äù refers to seeing smell, etc.

original: de las gzhan 'ga' zhig la zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa la'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan 'ga' zhig la zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn some other‚Äù refers to the desired.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni rtsol ba la sogs pa las so //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni rtsol ba la sogs pa las so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom that‚Äù refers to effort, etc.

original: yul la sogs pa nyid gang la 'jug snyam na /üîΩde dag kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yul la sogs pa nyid gang la 'jug snyam na / de dag kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In what way do the sense faculties and the objects operate?üîΩ‚ÄúThose‚Äù refers to the sense faculties and the objects.

original: dbang po dang blo dag kyang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang yul snga ma'i rgyu can yin no //
analyzed: dbang po dang blo dag kyang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang yul snga ma'i rgyu can yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe sense faculties and the mind‚Äù are also like that.

original: gal te 'dir bdag nye bar sbyor ba med du chug mod /
analyzed: gal te 'dir bdag nye bar sbyor ba med du chug mod /
translated: Even though the self may not be engaged in this,

original: dran pa la ni nye bar sbyor ba yod pa kho na'o zhes brtsad pa gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dran pa la ni nye bar sbyor ba yod pa kho na'o zhes brtsad pa gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: it is certainly engaged in memory.

original: srog la sogs pa ltar 'di yang ldog pa tsam la go ba ma yin no zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: srog la sogs pa ltar 'di yang ldog pa tsam la go ba ma yin no zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
translated: This is not merely a negation, like life, etc.

original: 'di yang zhes bya ba'i @196a * //
analyzed: 'di yang zhes bya ba'i @196a * //
translated: This is also like that.

original: ci ltar ldog pa kho na yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar ldog pa kho na yin zhe na /
translated: How is it merely a negation?

original: dran pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dran pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is memory.

original: 'o na ngo shes pas mthong zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ngo shes pas mthong zhe na /
translated: But if it is recognized, it is seen.

original: dran pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dran pa yang zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: don ci'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi 'khor lor mnyan bya nyid bkod ce na /

original: mnyan bya nyid dang mtshungs bas kyang srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa go byed ma yin par bstan pa'i don du yin no zhes brjod pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mnyan bya nyid dang mtshungs bas kyang srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa go byed ma yin par bstan pa'i don du yin no zhes brjod pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said, Moreover, in order to show that the object of hearing, etc., which are similar to the object of the reason, are not the subject.

original: dogs pa ni ma yin zhes bya ba ste mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: dogs pa ni ma yin zhes bya ba ste mtshungs pa'o //
translated: The doubt is expressed by not? and the similarity is expressed by is?.

original: de'i phyir zhes ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog ba can yin pa mnyan bya 'di ni 'khrul pa'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog ba can yin pa mnyan bya 'di ni 'khrul pa'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the object of hearing, which has the exclusion of the discordant side, is mistaken, it is said.

original: grub pa'i mthas ci ltar zhes dris so //
analyzed: grub pa'i mthas ci ltar zhes dris so //
translated: The conclusion asks, How?

original: gzhan gyis lan btab pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyis lan btab pa ni /
translated: The answer of the opponent is:

original: bsgrub par bya ba min pa nyid lam nyan bya nyid du ldog pa min te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba min pa nyid lam nyan bya nyid du ldog pa min te /
translated: The object of hearing is not the exclusion of the non-established,

original: 'on kyang bsgrub par bya ba las kyang ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang bsgrub par bya ba las kyang ngo //
translated: but rather of the established.

original: des na ldog pa can yin yang 'khrul pa yin no zhes na /üîΩgrub pa'i mtha' brjod pa ni /
analyzed: des na ldog pa can yin yang 'khrul pa yin no zhes na / grub pa'i mtha' brjod pa ni /
translated: Therefore, even though it has the exclusion, it is mistaken, it is said.

original: 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement of the conclusion is: Well then?

original: bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa kho na las ldog pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don gyis mnyan bya nyid mthun pa'i phyogs las kyang ldog pa @197b yin no zhes de ltar brjod bar 'gyur ba'i phyir de bsgrub par bya ba'i rjes su 'jug pa med
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa kho na las ldog pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don gyis mnyan bya nyid mthun pa'i phyogs las kyang ldog pa @197b yin no zhes de ltar brjod bar 'gyur ba'i phyir de bsgrub par bya ba'i rjes su 'jug pa med
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚ÄúIt is not the case that it is only the opposite of what is not to be established‚Äù is that the object of hearing is also the opposite of the similar class.

original: par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: par brjod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is said that it does not follow the object of establishment.

original: yin mod de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yin mod de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Granted, what follows from that?

original: de ni gzhan la'ang zhes bya ba srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa la yang mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa med pa de mtshungs so //
analyzed: de ni gzhan la'ang zhes bya ba srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa la yang mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa med pa de mtshungs so //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThat is the same for others‚Äù means that the absence of engagement in the similar class is the same for those possessing life and so on.

original: des na srog la sogs pa ni go bar byed pa yin la /
analyzed: des na srog la sogs pa ni go bar byed pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, life and so on are the understood,

original: mnyan bya nyid ni ma yin na ci ltar mtshungs she na /
analyzed: mnyan bya nyid ni ma yin na ci ltar mtshungs she na /
translated: but not the object of hearing. How are they similar?

original: mnyan bya nyid dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mnyan bya nyid dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe object of hearing‚Äù is the object of hearing.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: ldog pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ldog pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe opposite‚Äù is the opposite.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni khyab par med pas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni khyab par med pas na'o //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means because there is no pervasion.

original: ma yin zhes bya ba rnam par 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: ma yin zhes bya ba rnam par 'grel pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the statement ‚ÄúIt is not‚Äù is

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the statement ‚ÄúIf it were.‚Äù

original: ci ltar yul tha dad ce na /
analyzed: ci ltar yul tha dad ce na /
translated: How is the object different?

original: mnyan ba nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mnyan ba nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is the object of hearing, etc.

original: srog la sogs pa ni gnyi ga la yang ldog pa ma yin no zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa ni gnyi ga la yang ldog pa ma yin no zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: Life, etc. are not excluded from either.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba'o /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba'o /
translated: Because they are not to be established.

original: 'on don gyis de zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: 'on don gyis de zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'chad pa ni /
translated: But if it is explained that by the meaning, etc.,

original: 'o na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: then it is said if that is so, etc.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs la rjes su 'jug par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs la rjes su 'jug par byed pa'o //
translated: That is, in the similar instance, it is to be applied.

original: ci ltar mtshungs she na /
analyzed: ci ltar mtshungs she na /
translated: How is it similar?

original: de yang zhes bya ste srog la sogs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ste srog la sogs pa yang ngo //
translated: That, i.e., life, etc.,

original: ci ste yang mnyan bya nyid la mthun phyogs yod de des na de la yod pa'am med par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: ci ste yang mnyan bya nyid la mthun phyogs yod de des na de la yod pa'am med par 'gyur gyi /
translated: But if the similar instance is that of the object of hearing, etc., then it would exist or not exist there,

original: srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa la ni de med pa des na ci ltar de la med pa'am yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa la ni de med pa des na ci ltar de la med pa'am yod par 'gyur te /
translated: but it does not exist in that which possesses life, etc. So how could it exist or not exist there?

original: med ba ni gzhi la sogs par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med ba ni gzhi la sogs par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable that non-existence is a basis, etc.

original: des na rjes su 'jug pa med par ci ltar mtshungs snyam na /
analyzed: des na rjes su 'jug pa med par ci ltar mtshungs snyam na /
translated: Therefore, how can it be similar when there is no concomitance?

original: mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba'o //üîΩ'di nyid brjod pa ni /
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba'o // 'di nyid brjod pa ni /
translated: The expression ‚Äúin the similar class‚Äù is used.üîΩThis is what is being said.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The expression ‚Äúin this way‚Äù is used.

original: gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid las rnam par 'chad pa zhes bya ba ldog pa'i tshig gis mthun pa'i phyogs la gnas pa nyid brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid las rnam par 'chad pa zhes bya ba ldog pa'i tshig gis mthun pa'i phyogs la gnas pa nyid brjod pa yin no //
translated: The reason is stated in the expression ‚Äúbecause of the exclusion of the dissimilar class.‚Äù The word ‚Äúexclusion‚Äù indicates that the reason is present in the similar class.

original: gal te 'dis ldog pa brjod pa'i phyir ci ltar mthun pa'i phyogs la rjes su 'gro bar brjod pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'dis ldog pa brjod pa'i phyir ci ltar mthun pa'i phyogs la rjes su 'gro bar brjod pa yin zhe na /
translated: If this indicates exclusion, how does it indicate concomitance in the similar class?

original: don gyis go bas zhes bya ba ste nges par gzung ba'i shugs kyis so //
analyzed: don gyis go bas zhes bya ba ste nges par gzung ba'i shugs kyis so //
translated: It is understood by implication, that is, by the force of the specification.

original: de nyid phyir zhes bya ba ni don gyis go bas yod pa nyid yin ba'i phyir na khyed kyis kyang ldog pa bstan pa gcig gis rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gnyi ga bstan par bya bas so //
analyzed: de nyid phyir zhes bya ba ni don gyis go bas yod pa nyid yin ba'i phyir na khyed kyis kyang ldog pa bstan pa gcig gis rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gnyi ga bstan par bya bas so //
translated: The expression ‚Äúfor this very reason‚Äù means that because it is understood by implication, you also must teach both concomitance and exclusion by means of a single indication of exclusion.

original: de ltar ma yin na nges par gzung ba 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na nges par gzung ba 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the specification would be pointless.

original: phyed snga ma 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: phyed snga ma 'chad pa ni /
translated: The first half of the verse is explained:

original: nges par zhes bya ba'o //üîΩnges par gzung bar bya ba ni ldog pa yin la de las bzlog pa ni mthun pa'i @198a * //
analyzed: nges par zhes bya ba'o // nges par gzung bar bya ba ni ldog pa yin la de las bzlog pa ni mthun pa'i @198a * //
translated: ‚Äúcertainty‚Äù is the term.

original: phyogs la rjes su 'gro ba ste de sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs la rjes su 'gro ba ste de sgrub pa'o //
translated: The certainty is the exclusion, and the opposite of that is the inclusion in the similar instance. That is the proof.

original: don gyis go bas zhes bya ba de rnam par 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: don gyis go bas zhes bya ba de rnam par 'grel pa ni /
translated: The term ‚Äúunderstood by implication‚Äù is explained:

original: de ltar ma yin na zhes bya ba'o //üîΩgal te bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa kho na las rnam par chad pa zhes nges par gzung bas /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na zhes bya ba'o // gal te bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa kho na las rnam par chad pa zhes nges par gzung bas /
translated: ‚Äúif it were not so‚Äù is the explanation.üîΩIf it were certain that the exclusion were only from the dissimilar instance,

original: mthun pa'i phyogs las kyang rnam par chad pa yin na /
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs las kyang rnam par chad pa yin na /
translated: then it would also be excluded from the similar instance.

original: de'i tshe nges par gzung ba 'bras bu med do //
analyzed: de'i tshe nges par gzung ba 'bras bu med do //
translated: In that case, the certainty would be pointless.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu med pa kho na'i phyir khyed kyis kyang don gyis go bas ldog pa bstan pa gcig gis kyang gnyi ga bstan par byas pa yin no /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu med pa kho na'i phyir khyed kyis kyang don gyis go bas ldog pa bstan pa gcig gis kyang gnyi ga bstan par byas pa yin no /
translated: Therefore, because it would be pointless, you also teach the exclusion by implication. By teaching one, both are taught.

original: ldog pa rtogs pa ga las she na /
analyzed: ldog pa rtogs pa ga las she na /
translated: How is the exclusion understood?

original: bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa nyid las zhes bya ba'i ngag 'di las so //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa nyid las zhes bya ba'i ngag 'di las so //
translated: The statement ‚Äúbecause of the non-establishment of the object to be established‚Äù is the reason.

original: de'i phyir de ltar rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag phan tshun de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ldog pas rjes su 'gro ba 'phangs pa yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag phan tshun de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ldog pas rjes su 'gro ba 'phangs pa yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it has been explained that because of the mutual identity of the positive and negative concomitances, the negative concomitance is implied by the positive concomitance.

original: da ni ldog pa rtogs pa rjes 'gro des pa med par mi 'byung ba yin no zhes bshad pa gzhan brjod pa ni /
analyzed: da ni ldog pa rtogs pa rjes 'gro des pa med par mi 'byung ba yin no zhes bshad pa gzhan brjod pa ni /
translated: Now, in order to explain that the understanding of the negative concomitance does not occur without the positive concomitance, he states another reason:

original: yang na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúor else.‚Äù

original: 'o na ci ltar ldog pa rtogs she na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar ldog pa rtogs she na /
translated: How then is the negative concomitance understood?

original: rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy means of the positive concomitance.‚Äù

original: ci ltar rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas ldog pa rtogs she na /
analyzed: ci ltar rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas ldog pa rtogs she na /
translated: How is the negative concomitance understood by means of the positive concomitance?

original: bdag nyid la ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid la ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy means of the identity.‚Äù

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs gzhan las srog la sogs par ldog par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs gzhan las srog la sogs par ldog par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The life-force, etc. are ascertained as not occurring from other heterogeneous causes.

original: 'on te gzhan las mi ldog go zhe na /üîΩde las gzhan las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te gzhan las mi ldog go zhe na / de las gzhan las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúDo they not occur from other homogeneous causes?‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúFrom that other.‚Äù

original: de la ni bdag la'o //
analyzed: de la ni bdag la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that‚Äù refers to the self.

original: de lta na yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang ldan pa kho na gtan tshigs yin no zhes bya ba ni skabs kyi don to //
analyzed: de lta na yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang ldan pa kho na gtan tshigs yin no zhes bya ba ni skabs kyi don to //
translated: Nevertheless, the point of the present context is to show that the reason is only the presence of the forward and reverse pervasions.

original: 'di'i lan dogs par byed ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o /
analyzed: 'di'i lan dogs par byed ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o /
translated: The question that is anticipated is, ‚ÄúBut if that is so . . .‚Äù

original: // lan ni 'on zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: // lan ni 'on zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is, ‚ÄúWell, then . . .‚Äù

original: mi 'khrul ba yin no //
analyzed: mi 'khrul ba yin no //
translated: [The reason] is nonerroneous.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar ci ltar dgag pa 'gog pa sgrub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar ci ltar dgag pa 'gog pa sgrub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Because, as was said, ‚Äúthe negation of the negation is an affirmation.‚Äù

original: bsgrub par bya ba med pa nyid la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba med pa nyid la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: [The reason] is not the mere absence of the probandum.

original: 'o na med par yin par 'gyur bas zhes bya ba de la lan gyi dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: 'o na med par yin par 'gyur bas zhes bya ba de la lan gyi dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúWell, then, it would be a nonobservation of something absent,‚Äù the question that is anticipated is, ‚ÄúBut if that is so . . .‚Äù

original: ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is, ‚ÄúWell, then . . .‚Äù

original: srog la sogs pa ni mthun pa'i phyogs med pa las ldog pa des na /
analyzed: srog la sogs pa ni mthun pa'i phyogs med pa las ldog pa des na /
translated: Since the absence of life, etc., is the reverse of the presence of a similar class,

original: bsgrub bya min pa bum pa la sogs mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la srog la sogs pa med pa yin te des na mi 'khrul pa 'grub bo zhe na lan med ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsgrub bya min pa bum pa la sogs mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la srog la sogs pa med pa yin te des na mi 'khrul pa 'grub bo zhe na lan med ces bya ba'o //
translated: it is not the probandum. Since it is the absence of life, etc., in the dissimilar class itself, such as a pot, it is established as nonerroneous.

original: 'chad pa ni ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'chad pa ni ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation is, ‚ÄúWell, then . . .‚Äù

original: de las zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni /
translated: From that means

original: mthun pa'i phyogs las so //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs las so //
translated: from the concordant side.

original: phyed phyi ma 'chad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyed phyi ma 'chad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of the latter half is if.

original: dogs pa ni de yang zhes bya ba ste ldog ba'i ldog pa'o //
analyzed: dogs pa ni de yang zhes bya ba ste ldog ba'i ldog pa'o //
translated: The doubt is that also which is the negation of the negation.

original: lan ni gal @198b te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni gal @198b te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is if.

original: 'on te dgag pa la ltos te 'byung khungs su 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: 'on te dgag pa la ltos te 'byung khungs su 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: But if it is only a source in dependence on a negation,

original: ldog ba la ltos te ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ldog ba la ltos te ma yin no zhe na /
translated: and not in dependence on an exclusion,

original: bkag pa dang ldog pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bkag pa dang ldog pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then it is a negation and an exclusion.

original: don te gzhir ni 'thad kyi 'byung khungs su ni ma yin na /
analyzed: don te gzhir ni 'thad kyi 'byung khungs su ni ma yin na /
translated: It is tenable as a basis, but not as a source,

original: ldog pa'i zhes smos so //
analyzed: ldog pa'i zhes smos so //
translated: so of an exclusion is stated.

original: med pa la ni 'ga' zhig dang ldan ba sngon du song ba'i bral ba med pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: med pa la ni 'ga' zhig dang ldan ba sngon du song ba'i bral ba med pa'i phyir na /
translated: Since there is no separation that precedes possession of a non-existent,

original: 'byung khungs ma yin no zhes zur na 'dug pa'i rtsod pa brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung khungs ma yin no zhes zur na 'dug pa'i rtsod pa brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: it is not a source. The objection from the side is stated in if.

original: lhas byin dang grong ldan ba yin la de dang bral ba na yang grong 'byung khungs yin no //
analyzed: lhas byin dang grong ldan ba yin la de dang bral ba na yang grong 'byung khungs yin no //
translated: Devadatta is a villager, and when he is separated from that, the village is a source.

original: dngos po med pa dang ni gtan tshigs ldan ba med pa des na ci ltar de la ltos te 'byung khungs yin zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po med pa dang ni gtan tshigs ldan ba med pa des na ci ltar de la ltos te 'byung khungs yin zhe na /
translated: Since there is no entity and no possession of reason, how can it be a source in dependence on that?

original: gang dang zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: gang dang zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The response is ‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù

original: ci ste ma yin te 'on kyang yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: ci ste ma yin te 'on kyang yin pa kho na'o //
translated: If it is not so, but rather it is so,

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: how?

original: bral ba tsam la zhes bya ba'o /
analyzed: bral ba tsam la zhes bya ba'o /
translated: ‚ÄúJust the mere separation‚Äù is stated.

original: mi 'dod pa bzlog pa ni ldan par yang ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa bzlog pa ni ldan par yang ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reversal of the undesirable is ‚Äúalso.‚Äù

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù is

original: ldan pa sngon du 'gro bas gzhi yin na'o //
analyzed: ldan pa sngon du 'gro bas gzhi yin na'o //
translated: if there is possession beforehand, it is the basis.

original: der ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: der ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThere‚Äù is

original: sdig pa las zlog go zhes bya ba sdig pa la /
analyzed: sdig pa las zlog go zhes bya ba sdig pa la /
translated: in the reversal from evil.

original: 'dir yang zhes bya ba la ni dngos bo med pa la'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang zhes bya ba la ni dngos bo med pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHere‚Äù is in the non-entity.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni 'dod pas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni 'dod pas na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù is because of the desire.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù is the non-entity.

original: 'di nyid brjod ba ni gang la zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di nyid brjod ba ni gang la zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is stated as ‚Äúwhere,‚Äù

original: dngos po med pa la'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa la'o //
