translated: in the non-entity.

original: don de na gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: don de na gtan tshigs so //
translated: That is the reason.

original: ci ltar de de'i 'byung khungs yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar de de'i 'byung khungs yin zhe na /
translated: How is it the source of that?

original: mthun pa'i phyogs med pa la gtan tshigs med pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis /
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs med pa la gtan tshigs med pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis /
translated: The words ‚Äúwhere there is no similar instance, there is no reason‚Äù

original: ldog pa med pa sgrub pa nyid dngos po yod pa'i mtshan nyid can du bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ldog pa med pa sgrub pa nyid dngos po yod pa'i mtshan nyid can du bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: indicate that the absence of a counter-example is a characteristic of the existence of a real entity.

original: de ni med pa'ang yod pa yin la /
analyzed: de ni med pa'ang yod pa yin la /
translated: But that is not so, for

original: dngos bo med pa'i mtshan nyid ldog ba ni med ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni /
analyzed: dngos bo med pa'i mtshan nyid ldog ba ni med ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni /
translated: the absence of a counter-example is the characteristic of a non-existent real entity.

original: mi shes pa'i spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: mi shes pa'i spyod pa yin no //
translated: This is the conduct of the ignorant.

original: bzlog kyang cig shos ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bzlog kyang cig shos ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúEven if the other is reversed‚Äù

original: dngos po la dngos po 'thad pa yin yang med do zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: dngos po la dngos po 'thad pa yin yang med do zhes 'brel to //
translated: means that even if a real entity is tenable in a real entity, it is still nonexistent.

original: 'di ltar mthun pa'i phyogs bdag dang bcas pa la /
analyzed: 'di ltar mthun pa'i phyogs bdag dang bcas pa la /
translated: Thus, in a similar instance that possesses a self,

original: srog la sogs pa yod pa 'thad pa yin yang med pa yin te /
analyzed: srog la sogs pa yod pa 'thad pa yin yang med pa yin te /
translated: life, etc., are tenable, but they are nonexistent.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs tshad mas rab tu ma grub pa ni yod par the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs tshad mas rab tu ma grub pa ni yod par the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the existence of a similar instance that is not established by a valid cognition is doubtful.

original: gal te rnam pa gzhan srid pa'i phyir nyes pa 'dir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rnam pa gzhan srid pa'i phyir nyes pa 'dir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If you say that this fault arises because another aspect is possible,

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then it is as follows.

original: ci ltar 'di gnyis de ltar gnas she na /
analyzed: ci ltar 'di gnyis de ltar gnas she na /
translated: How do these two exist in that way?

original: rnam gzhan zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rnam gzhan zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is said, ‚Äúin another way.‚Äù

original: des na gnyi ga med ces bya ba ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: des na gnyi ga med ces bya ba ni mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to say that both are nonexistent.

original: gal te med pa la sgrub par byed pa med kyang ci ltar 'jug pa yin @199a * //
analyzed: gal te med pa la sgrub par byed pa med kyang ci ltar 'jug pa yin @199a * //
translated: If the nonexistent does not have a proof, how does it engage?

original: zhe na / brjod pa mthun pa'i phyogs la sgrub par byed pa'i dngos po yod pa ma yin na'o //
analyzed: zhe na / brjod pa mthun pa'i phyogs la sgrub par byed pa'i dngos po yod pa ma yin na'o //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúIf the property of the position does not exist in the similar class, then the nonexistent does not have a proof.‚Äù

original: de nyid ni zhes bya ba ni med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ni zhes bya ba ni med pa nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúThat itself‚Äù means nonexistence.

original: gal te dngos po yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po yod pa ma yin na /
translated: If the existent does not exist,

original: gor ma chag par med pa nyid yin mod /
analyzed: gor ma chag par med pa nyid yin mod /
translated: then without a doubt it is nonexistent.

original: de lta na yang ci ltar de nyid de las ltos pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang ci ltar de nyid de las ltos pa yin zhe na /
translated: Even so, how is that itself dependent on that?

original: mthun pa'i phyogs de las med pa ni mthun pa'i phyogs de las mi ldog pa ma yin te 'on kyang ldog pa kho na'o //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs de las med pa ni mthun pa'i phyogs de las mi ldog pa ma yin te 'on kyang ldog pa kho na'o //
translated: The nonexistent in the similar class is not undifferentiated from the similar class, but rather it is differentiated.

original: dogs ba ni med pa nyid kyang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dogs ba ni med pa nyid kyang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The doubt is, ‚ÄúEven nonexistence . . .‚Äù

original: ldog pa mi 'thad pa 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi sgrub bar byed pa med pa nyid kyang med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: ldog pa mi 'thad pa 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi sgrub bar byed pa med pa nyid kyang med pa kho na'o //
translated: Not only is the reversal untenable, but also the proof itself is nonexistent.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzhi nyid dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhi nyid dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The basis itself.

original: lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is ‚Äúnot so.‚Äù

original: dogs pa ni de yang zhes bya ba ste dngos po med pa yang ngo //
analyzed: dogs pa ni de yang zhes bya ba ste dngos po med pa yang ngo //
translated: The doubt is ‚Äúthat‚Äù and ‚Äúnonexistent.‚Äù

original: lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ste gnyi ga dgag pa zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ste gnyi ga dgag pa zhes 'brel to //
translated: The response is ‚Äúnot so,‚Äù which is connected with ‚Äúthe negation of both.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dngos po dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The entity itself.

original: gal te phan tshun med pa'i rang bzhin yin yang ci ltar gnyi ga dgag pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te phan tshun med pa'i rang bzhin yin yang ci ltar gnyi ga dgag pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: If it is the case that even though they are mutually absent, how is it that both are not negated?

original: dngos po ni zhes bya ba'o //üîΩgal te gang gis rnam pa gzhan med par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: dngos po ni zhes bya ba'o // gal te gang gis rnam pa gzhan med par 'gyur ba /
translated: The entity itself.üîΩIf it is the case that by the negation of nonexistence, the entity would become existent,

original: dngos po med pa bkag na nges par dngos po yod ba ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po med pa bkag na nges par dngos po yod ba ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: how is it that the entity becomes existent?

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because of that.

original: de ldog na zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa ldog na'o //
analyzed: de ldog na zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa ldog na'o //
translated: If the nonexistence is negated, then the entity is negated.

original: 'di nyid ldog pa'i sgo nas bstan par byed pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid ldog pa'i sgo nas bstan par byed pa ni /
translated: This is taught by way of the negation:

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it were not so,üîΩit would be non-existent.‚Äù

original: med pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni skabs kyis na da ros po'o //
analyzed: med pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni skabs kyis na da ros po'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is understood in the context.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa brjod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa brjod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThus‚Äù refers to the summary verse.

original: dogs ba ni de yang zhes bya ba ste dngos po yang ngo //
analyzed: dogs ba ni de yang zhes bya ba ste dngos po yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúFearing‚Äù means that ‚Äúit‚Äù is also a thing.

original: lan ni dgag ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni dgag ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is ‚Äúthe negation.‚Äù

original: de yang min na zhes bya ba'i dgag pa 'di lta bu ni mi dmigs pas rnam par gzhag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang min na zhes bya ba'i dgag pa 'di lta bu ni mi dmigs pas rnam par gzhag par bya ba yin no //
translated: And this kind of negation, ‚Äúif it were not so,‚Äù is to be established by non-apprehension.

original: mi dmigs bas dngos bo med pa rnam par 'jog pa ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: mi dmigs bas dngos bo med pa rnam par 'jog pa ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is non-existence established by non-apprehension?

original: med phyir ro zhes bya ba ste mi dmigs pa ni med pa'i rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med phyir ro zhes bya ba ste mi dmigs pa ni med pa'i rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of non-existence,‚Äù because non-apprehension has the nature of non-existence.

original: 'on gnyi ga yang med do zhe na gnyi ga med na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on gnyi ga yang med do zhe na gnyi ga med na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If both are non-existent, then ‚Äúif both are non-existent.‚Äù

original: dngos med ni zhes bya bar sgrub par byed pa med pa'o //
analyzed: dngos med ni zhes bya bar sgrub par byed pa med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNon-existence‚Äù is the absence of establishment.

original: dngos po bkag pa nyid dngos po med pa yin te des na dngos po med pa ni zlog tu med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: dngos po bkag pa nyid dngos po med pa yin te des na dngos po med pa ni zlog tu med pa kho na'o //
translated: An absence of entity is an entity that is a negation, and thus an absence of entity is certainly not to be negated.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it were,

original: dngos po med pa nyid bstan nas /
analyzed: dngos po med pa nyid bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the absence of entity,

original: dngos po med pa'i med pa nyid brjod pa ni /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i med pa nyid brjod pa ni /
translated: he states the absence of the absence of entity:

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde lta na yang dngos po med par bzlog tu med pa ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba'o // de lta na yang dngos po med par bzlog tu med pa ji ltar zhe na /
translated: In the same way,üîΩIf it were, then how could an absence of entity not be negated?

original: dngos por yang mi 'gyur na ni zhes bya ba'o//
analyzed: dngos por yang mi 'gyur na ni zhes bya ba'o//
translated: If it were not an entity,

original: @199b dgag pa 'di zhes bya ba de mjug bsdu ba'i sgo nas rnam par 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: @199b dgag pa 'di zhes bya ba de mjug bsdu ba'i sgo nas rnam par 'grel pa ni /
translated: This negation is summarized in the phrase

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore,

original: 'on te dngos po med pa'i tshad mas dgag pa rnam par 'jog pa yin la /
analyzed: 'on te dngos po med pa'i tshad mas dgag pa rnam par 'jog pa yin la /
translated: If you say that a negation is posited by a valid cognition of an absence of entity,

original: dngos po ni mngon sum nyid kyis yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po ni mngon sum nyid kyis yin no zhe na /
translated: and an entity is posited by perception,

original: de'i phyir tshad ma zhes bya ba ste gang gi phyir mngon sum gyis bsgrub pa las phyi rol tu gyur pa 'di rnam par 'jog pa de'i phyir tshad ma gcig 'jug pa nyid kyis rnam pa gzhan la ste bzlog pa la /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad ma zhes bya ba ste gang gi phyir mngon sum gyis bsgrub pa las phyi rol tu gyur pa 'di rnam par 'jog pa de'i phyir tshad ma gcig 'jug pa nyid kyis rnam pa gzhan la ste bzlog pa la /
translated: Therefore, it is called a valid cognition, because it is posited as external to the establishment of perception. Therefore, by the mere engagement of one valid cognition, in the other mode, i.e., the opposite,

original: rnam pa gzhan gyi ngo bor te /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyi ngo bor te /
translated: in the nature of the other mode,

original: de las bzlog pa nyid du 'jog pa yin no //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa nyid du 'jog pa yin no //
translated: it is posited as the opposite of that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dngos po dang dngos po med pa las ma gtogs pa'i rnam ba gzhan ni srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dngos po dang dngos po med pa las ma gtogs pa'i rnam ba gzhan ni srid pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, a mode other than existence and nonexistence is not possible.

original: ci ltar tshad ma gcig nyid kyis rnam pa gzhan la rnam pa gzhan nyid du rnam bar 'jog ce na /
analyzed: ci ltar tshad ma gcig nyid kyis rnam pa gzhan la rnam pa gzhan nyid du rnam bar 'jog ce na /
translated: How is it that by one valid cognition alone, in the other mode, the other mode is posited as different?

original: gang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said:üîΩ‚ÄúIf that is so, then how is the other mode, which is the absence of that, not the nature of that?‚Äù It is said:

original: gal te de lta na yang gang gi rnam pa gzhan med pa nyid du 'gyur ba ci ltar na gzhan de'i ngo bor med ce na dngos po'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang gang gi rnam pa gzhan med pa nyid du 'gyur ba ci ltar na gzhan de'i ngo bor med ce na dngos po'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe nature of an entity.‚Äù

original: de la ni dngos po'i rang bzhin la'o //
analyzed: de la ni dngos po'i rang bzhin la'o //
translated: There, in the nature of an entity.

original: de'i zhes bya ba dngos po'i rang bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba dngos po'i rang bzhin du'o //
translated: In the nature of an entity means in the nature of an entity that exists.

original: de'i rang bzhin du med pa ni dngos po'i rang bzhin du'o //üîΩde ltar dngos po'i rang bzhin du yongs su ma bcad pa ni dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin kho na yin no zhes bstan nas /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin du med pa ni dngos po'i rang bzhin du'o // de ltar dngos po'i rang bzhin du yongs su ma bcad pa ni dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin kho na yin no zhes bstan nas /
translated: Nonexistence in the nature of that is in the nature of an entity.

original: dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin du yongs su ma bcad pa yang dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin du yongs su ma bcad pa yang dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: Having thus shown that the nonexclusion of the nature of an entity is the nature of a nonentity, he states that the nonexclusion of the nature of a nonentity is the nature of an entity.

original: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: A nonentity is that which does not exist.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin du'o //
translated: In the nature of a nonentity means in the nature of a nonentity that exists.

original: rnam 'grel la 'jug par byed pa ni /
analyzed: rnam 'grel la 'jug par byed pa ni /
translated: The introduction to the commentary is

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù means:üîΩ

original: mthun pa'i phyogs de ni dngos po'am dngos po med par gyur ba zhig yin no //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs de ni dngos po'am dngos po med par gyur ba zhig yin no //
translated: The similar class is either an entity or a nonentity.

original: de la med pa'i phyogs la rtsod par smra ba skyon brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de la med pa'i phyogs la rtsod par smra ba skyon brjod pa ni /
translated: The opponent‚Äôs objection to the nonexistence of the similar class is

original: mthun pa'i phyogs med pa la gtan tshigs med do zhes dgag pa gzhi dang bcas pa yongs su bcad par mi nus so //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs med pa la gtan tshigs med do zhes dgag pa gzhi dang bcas pa yongs su bcad par mi nus so //
translated: The opponent's position is: If there is no similar instance, there is no reason, and so it is not possible to ascertain a negation together with its basis.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzhi nyid du 'dod pa'i mthun pa'i phyogs de nyid bcad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhi nyid du 'dod pa'i mthun pa'i phyogs de nyid bcad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that similar instance which is asserted as the basis itself is not ascertained.

original: ma bcad pa'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ma bcad pa'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If it is said, Because it is not ascertained,

original: med pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: med pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: it is said, Non-existent.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni mthun phyogs med pa la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni mthun phyogs med pa la'o //
translated: Here, in that refers to the absence of a similar instance.

original: de'i tshe 'jug par 'dod dam zhes dri ba'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'jug par 'dod dam zhes dri ba'o //
translated: At that time, it is asked, Is it asserted to engage?

original: gzhan gyis brjod pas 'jug pa de yang 'dod pa min na /üîΩlan btab pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyis brjod pas 'jug pa de yang 'dod pa min na / lan btab pa ni /
translated: If it is said, That engagement is not asserted,

original: de yang min zhes bstan pa 'di nyid ni bkag pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang min zhes bstan pa 'di nyid ni bkag pa yin te /
translated: the reply is, That is also not so. This very statement is the negation.

original: des na ldog pa ci ltar 'gog te mi 'gog ba kho na'o //
analyzed: des na ldog pa ci ltar 'gog te mi 'gog ba kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, how is the negation stopped? It is not stopped at all.

original: ldog pa bkag pa @200a * //
analyzed: ldog pa bkag pa @200a * //
translated: The negation of the negation is said to be another aspect.

original: 'jug pa ci'i phyir yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'jug pa ci'i phyir yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it the negation of the negation?

original: rnam pa gzhan ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said, another aspect.

original: de nyid ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid ci ltar zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said, in that way.

original: dogs ba ni de yang zhes bya ba ste 'jug ba'o //
analyzed: dogs ba ni de yang zhes bya ba ste 'jug ba'o //
translated: The doubt is stated in the words ‚Äúand that.‚Äù

original: lan ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //üîΩci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: lan ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o // ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: The response is stated in the words ‚ÄúWell then.‚ÄùüîΩWhy?

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reason is stated in the words ‚Äúbecause.‚Äù

original: rgyu de'i phyir mthun pa'i phyogs de las gtan tshigs ldog pa ci ste 'gog par byed de mi bya ba kho na'o //üîΩci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir mthun pa'i phyogs de las gtan tshigs ldog pa ci ste 'gog par byed de mi bya ba kho na'o // ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: For that reason, why would you deny that the reason is absent in the similar instances? You should not deny it.üîΩWhy?

original: bsgrub pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsgrub pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is stated in the words ‚Äúbecause it is the probandum.‚Äù

original: de ni mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'o /
analyzed: de ni mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'o /
translated: This is the absence of similar instances.

original: des las mi mthun pa'i phyogs las so //üîΩbrgal zhing brtag pa byed pa'i rnam par brjod pa ni /
analyzed: des las mi mthun pa'i phyogs las so // brgal zhing brtag pa byed pa'i rnam par brjod pa ni /
translated: The reason is absent in dissimilar instances.

original: srog la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement of the objection is stated in the words ‚Äúlife force, etc.‚Äù

original: de na gdon mi za bar brjod par bya dgos te zhes 'brel to //üîΩbrjod pa'i tshul smras pa ni /
analyzed: de na gdon mi za bar brjod par bya dgos te zhes 'brel to // brjod pa'i tshul smras pa ni /
translated: The connection is stated in the words ‚Äútherefore, you must certainly state.‚Äù

original: mthun pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mthun pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The way to state the response is stated in the words ‚Äúin the similar instances.‚Äù

original: brgal zhing brtags pa na khyed kyis gor ma chag par 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: brgal zhing brtags pa na khyed kyis gor ma chag par 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: When you are questioned, you should certainly state the following.

original: de lta ma yin na ste ma smras na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ste ma smras na /
translated: If you do not state it,

original: dngos po med pa'i skabs 'dir byed mi smra ba nyid 'thob po mi smra ba nyid khas len par dogs pa ni //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i skabs 'dir byed mi smra ba nyid 'thob po mi smra ba nyid khas len par dogs pa ni //
translated: The doubt is whether one accepts the very silence about it.

original: ci ste yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ste yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf, on the other hand‚Äù is the doubt.

original: de bzhin kho nar zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa la mi smra ba kho nar 'gyur ba ste de'i yul can gyi blo med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin kho nar zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa la mi smra ba kho nar 'gyur ba ste de'i yul can gyi blo med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúJust as‚Äù means that there would be the very silence about non-entityness, because there would be no cognition that has it as its object.

original: lan ni de'i yul can gyi blo med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lan ni de'i yul can gyi blo med pa ma yin no //
translated: The reply is that there is not the non-existence of the cognition that has it as its object.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rang nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of itself‚Äù is the reply.

original: ma yin pa'i phyogs la dngos po'i rang bzhin du gcod pa 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi /
analyzed: ma yin pa'i phyogs la dngos po'i rang bzhin du gcod pa 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi /
translated: It is not only that there is the exclusion of the nature of entity in the case of the non-entity,

original: byed pa dgag pa rang nyid kyi rnam pa 'ga' zhig ltar gcod pa srid ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa dgag pa rang nyid kyi rnam pa 'ga' zhig ltar gcod pa srid ba'i phyir ro //
translated: but also the exclusion of the negation of activity is possible in some of its aspects.

original: gal te gang gis yongs su gcod par 'gyur ba tshig bzhin du de'i yul can gyi blor yang ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gang gis yongs su gcod par 'gyur ba tshig bzhin du de'i yul can gyi blor yang ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúHow could it be like the word that would bring about the exclusion, in the case of the cognition that has it as its object?‚Äù

original: tshig zhi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshig zhi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe word‚Äù is the reply.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gdon mi za bar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúUndoubtedly‚Äù means ‚Äúwithout a doubt.‚Äù

original: rtog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: rtog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: ‚ÄúOne would imagine‚Äù means ‚Äúone would think.‚Äù

original: de ltar ma yin na gom gcig kyang mi 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na gom gcig kyang mi 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, one would not even take a single step.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni dgag pa'i don dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni dgag pa'i don dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means ‚Äúbecause of the very fact that the meaning of negation is the nature of non-existence.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir dngos po med pa ma rtogs na dgag pa mi sbyor zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dngos po med pa ma rtogs na dgag pa mi sbyor zhe na /
translated: Why, if one does not understand non-existence, does one not apply negation?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù means ‚Äúin that way.‚Äù

original: ci'i ched du sbyor zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i ched du sbyor zhe na /
translated: For what purpose does one apply it?

original: brjod par bya ba de nyid rtogs par byed pa'i phyir te nges pa'i ched du'o //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba de nyid rtogs par byed pa'i phyir te nges pa'i ched du'o //
translated: In order to understand that very thing to be expressed, i.e., for the sake of ascertainment.

original: de gnyis zhes bya ba ni blo'i yul dang rjod par byed pa sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de gnyis zhes bya ba ni blo'i yul dang rjod par byed pa sbyor ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThose two‚Äù are the object of the mind and the application of the expression.

original: dngos po med pa brjod par bya bar byed pa na /üîΩdgag par bya ba'i dngos bo dang bral ba'am /
analyzed: dngos po med pa brjod par bya bar byed pa na / dgag par bya ba'i dngos bo dang bral ba'am /
translated: When one makes non-existence the object of expression,üîΩis it the thing to be negated that is separated,

original: khyad @200b par de dang bcas pa zhig yul du byed grang na /
analyzed: khyad @200b par de dang bcas pa zhig yul du byed grang na /
translated: or is it the particular that is separated?

original: phyogs dang po la nyes pa brjod pa ni /
analyzed: phyogs dang po la nyes pa brjod pa ni /
translated: The fault in the first case is stated:

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù is the word.

original: gnyis pa la brjod pa ni /
analyzed: gnyis pa la brjod pa ni /
translated: The second is stated:

original: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBut if‚Äù is the word.

original: 'on te rtogs pa ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'on te rtogs pa ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúBut if the cognition‚Äù is the word.

original: shar phyogs la sogs pa'i yul dang 'brel pa nyid du rnam pa gzhan du yin la med pa yang rnam pa gzhan du ste yul gzhan na gnas pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: shar phyogs la sogs pa'i yul dang 'brel pa nyid du rnam pa gzhan du yin la med pa yang rnam pa gzhan du ste yul gzhan na gnas pa nyid kyis so //
translated: It is not related to the eastern direction, etc., in any other way, but by the mere fact of its being located in another place.

original: yul dus zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yul dus zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúPlace and time‚Äù is the word.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i yul dang dus su bum pa 'gog ba yin gyi /
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i yul dang dus su bum pa 'gog ba yin gyi /
translated: The pot is negated in the place and time that are intended,

original: thams cad du ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad du ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: but not everywhere.

original: 'di ni bum pa la 'du ba dang / sngon po la sogs pa'i chos 'gog ba'i nye bar mtshon byed do //
analyzed: 'di ni bum pa la 'du ba dang / sngon po la sogs pa'i chos 'gog ba'i nye bar mtshon byed do //
translated: This is an illustration of the negation of the pot‚Äôs assembly and of the properties of the pot, such as its blueness.

original: yang na bum pa dang 'brel pa'i mngon par 'dod pa'i yul dang dus dang bum pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'i chos dang 'brel ba nyid 'gog pa yin gyi /
analyzed: yang na bum pa dang 'brel pa'i mngon par 'dod pa'i yul dang dus dang bum pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'i chos dang 'brel ba nyid 'gog pa yin gyi /
translated: Or, the mere fact of the pot‚Äôs relation to the intended place and time and the mere fact of the pot‚Äôs properties, such as its blueness, are negated,

original: thams cad ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: but not everything.

original: de ltar rtsod pa rjes su brjod nas lan 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar rtsod pa rjes su brjod nas lan 'debs pa ni /
translated: Having thus stated the opponent‚Äôs argument, the reply is as follows:

original: ci ltar yul gzhan na gnas pa la sogs pas bum pa de yod pa de ltar ni mi 'gog te /
analyzed: ci ltar yul gzhan na gnas pa la sogs pas bum pa de yod pa de ltar ni mi 'gog te /
translated: It is not denied that the pot exists in the way it is found to exist by one who is situated in a different place, etc.

original: yul dgag pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul dgag pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For it is not tenable to deny the place.

original: ci ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i yul na gnas pa la sogs par bum pa med pa de ltar yang 'gog pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i yul na gnas pa la sogs par bum pa med pa de ltar yang 'gog pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it denied that the pot does not exist in the way it is found not to exist by one who is situated in the place, etc.

original: med pa ni blo'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩyang na ci ltar yul la sogs ba bum pa dang 'brel ba nyid du yod pa de ltar ni 'gog pa ma yin la /
analyzed: med pa ni blo'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro // yang na ci ltar yul la sogs ba bum pa dang 'brel ba nyid du yod pa de ltar ni 'gog pa ma yin la /
translated: that is desired, because the nonexistent is not an object of cognition.üîΩOr else, it is not denied that the place, etc. exist in a relation of inherence with the pot.

original: ci ltar bum pa dang 'brel pa nyid du yul la sogs pa med pa de ltar yang 'gog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ci ltar bum pa dang 'brel pa nyid du yul la sogs pa med pa de ltar yang 'gog pa ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it denied that the place, etc. do not exist in a relation of inherence with the pot.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa dang 'du bar ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa dang 'du bar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIn this way‚Äù means in the relation of inherence with blue, etc.

original: rang bzhin gang zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i chos dang 'brel ba bum pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gang zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i chos dang 'brel ba bum pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúIts intrinsic nature‚Äù means the intrinsic nature of the pot, etc. in a relation with the property of blue, etc.

original: de zhes bya ba ni bum pa dang 'brel pa'i yul la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni bum pa dang 'brel pa'i yul la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù means the place, etc. in a relation with the pot.

original: de'i tshe ci ltar 'gog ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe ci ltar 'gog ste /
translated: How can it be refuted at that time?

original: med pa'i phyir mi 'gog pa kho na'o //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir mi 'gog pa kho na'o //
translated: It is not refuted because it does not exist.

original: 'on ta bum pa dang 'brel pa'i yul la sogs pa'i med pa nyid yin na de'i tshe blos yul du byed pa mi srid do //
analyzed: 'on ta bum pa dang 'brel pa'i yul la sogs pa'i med pa nyid yin na de'i tshe blos yul du byed pa mi srid do //
translated: But if the non-existence of the object, etc. is related to the pot, then at that time it is impossible for the mind to take it as an object.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: med pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: med pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is called non-existence.

original: ci ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ci ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: If one says,

original: bum pa dang 'brel pa'i yul la sogs pa med kyang yul du na'o //
analyzed: bum pa dang 'brel pa'i yul la sogs pa med kyang yul du na'o //
translated: even though the non-existence of the object, etc. is related to the pot, it is the object.

original: bum pa dang 'brel ba nyid du ni ma zad de /
analyzed: bum pa dang 'brel ba nyid du ni ma zad de /
translated: Not only is it related to the pot,

original: 'on kyang gzhi la sogs par yang ngo //üîΩci'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa dang 'brel pa nyid du //
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhi la sogs par yang ngo // ci'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa dang 'brel pa nyid du //
translated: but also to the ground, etc.

original: yul la sogs ba yul du byas na /üîΩgzhi la sogs par yang yul du byed par @201a * //
analyzed: yul la sogs ba yul du byas na / gzhi la sogs par yang yul du byed par @201a * //
translated: Why is it that when the object, etc. related to the pot is taken as an object,

original: 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'gyur zhe na /
translated: the ground, etc. are also taken as objects?

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If it were not so,

original: gzhi la sogs par yongs su bcad pa med par da dang 'brel ba can nyid du yul du bya bar mi nus ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhi la sogs par yongs su bcad pa med par da dang 'brel ba can nyid du yul du bya bar mi nus ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not possible to take as an object that which is related to the pot without determining it as the ground, etc.

original: de nyid brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid brjod pa ni /
translated: That is stated:

original: gdon mi za bar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is inevitable‚Äù means that it is certain.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni gzhi la sogs bar yul du ma byas na'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni gzhi la sogs bar yul du ma byas na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means that if the basis, etc., are not taken as the object.

original: de dang 'brel pa nyid du yongs su gcod pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa nyid du yongs su gcod pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible to determine that it is related to that.

original: gzhi'i ngo bor yul du byed mod snyam na /
analyzed: gzhi'i ngo bor yul du byed mod snyam na /
translated: If you think that it is taken as the object in the nature of the basis,

original: yul 'di na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yul 'di na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis object here‚Äù means that it is taken as the object in the nature of the basis.

original: gzhi'i ngo bor med par mi ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhi'i ngo bor med par mi ltar 'gyur /
translated: ‚ÄúIt would not be seen as not existing‚Äù means that it would not be seen as not existing in the nature of the basis.

original: med na zhes bya ba ni med pa blo'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med na zhes bya ba ni med pa blo'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it does not exist‚Äù means that because non-existence is not the object of the mind,

original: de bzhin du yul la sogs pa dang / 'brel pa'i bum pa 'gog pa la yang nyes pa brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yul la sogs pa dang / 'brel pa'i bum pa 'gog pa la yang nyes pa brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: in the same way, the fault should be stated in the negation of the pot that is related to the object, etc.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBut if‚Äù means a doubt.

original: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù is the answer.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs bdag dang bcas pa yang ngo //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs bdag dang bcas pa yang ngo //
translated: The similar class is also endowed with a self.

original: de'i phyir srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa ni mnyan bya nyid bzhin du mthun ba'i phyogs la 'jug pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa ni mnyan bya nyid bzhin du mthun ba'i phyogs la 'jug pa med pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, because the possession of life, etc., is like the quality of being audible, it does not occur in the similar class.

original: des na mnyan bya nyid dang 'dra bar srog la sogs pa yang go bar byed pa ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na mnyan bya nyid dang 'dra bar srog la sogs pa yang go bar byed pa ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, like what is to be heard, life force, etc. are not understood. This is the meaning.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa la dgag bsgrub mi 'thad bas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa la dgag bsgrub mi 'thad bas na'o //
translated: ‚Äú Therefore‚Äù means because it is not tenable to affirm or negate existence and non-existence.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äú For that reason‚Äù means because it is impossible.

original: ci ltar bsgrub pa med ce na /
analyzed: ci ltar bsgrub pa med ce na /
translated: How is there no affirmation?

original: bum pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bum pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú A pot‚Äù is the example.

original: gal te bum pa'i sgra las bum pa yod do zhes bden par yongs su 'dzin na de'i tshe de nyid bsgrub par yin pa'i phyir yang yod do zhes bya ba'i bsgrub pa bstan zin pa ston pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: gal te bum pa'i sgra las bum pa yod do zhes bden par yongs su 'dzin na de'i tshe de nyid bsgrub par yin pa'i phyir yang yod do zhes bya ba'i bsgrub pa bstan zin pa ston pas ci zhig bya /
translated: If one grasps as real ‚Äúa pot exists‚Äù from the word ‚Äúpot,‚Äù then at that time, since that is what is to be affirmed, what is the use of stating ‚Äúexists‚Äù again to indicate what is to be affirmed?

original: 'on te bum pa'i sgra la bum pa med pa nyid du yongs su 'dzin na de'i tshe de ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te bum pa'i sgra la bum pa med pa nyid du yongs su 'dzin na de'i tshe de ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But if one grasps ‚Äúa pot does not exist‚Äù from the word ‚Äúpot,‚Äù then at that time, ‚Äúthat‚Äù is the example.

original: 'di nyid sdud ba ni gal te zhes bya pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid sdud ba ni gal te zhes bya pa'o //
translated: This is summarized in the line ‚ÄúIf . . .‚Äù

original: 'on bsgrub pa dang dgag pa'i tha snyad ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'on bsgrub pa dang dgag pa'i tha snyad ci ltar zhe na /
translated: But how can there be the conventions of affirmation and negation?

original: de phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Therefore‚Äù is the response.

original: gang gi phyir phyi rol la brten pa'i dgag bsgrub kyi tha snyad mi 'thad pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir phyi rol la brten pa'i dgag bsgrub kyi tha snyad mi 'thad pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the conventions of refutation and proof based on external things are not tenable.

original: sgra don rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa la'o //
analyzed: sgra don rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa la'o //
translated: [The conventions of refutation and proof] are based on the aspects of conceptual images of terms and meanings.

original: gal te phyi rol la nges pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: gal te phyi rol la nges pa'i phyir na /
translated: If [the conventions of refutation and proof] are based on external things,

original: sgra'i don yod bsgrub pa dang / dgag pa'i yul ci ltar yin zhen /
analyzed: sgra'i don yod bsgrub pa dang / dgag pa'i yul ci ltar yin zhen /
translated: how can the objects of refutation and proof be the referents of terms?

original: gang gi phyir phyi rol la rten pa min pas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir phyi rol la rten pa min pas so //
translated: Because [the conventions of refutation and proof] are not based on external things.

original: de nyid ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gang gi phyir dngos po dang dngos po med pa la brten pas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po dang dngos po med pa la brten pas so //
translated: Because [the conventions of refutation and proof] are based on things and non-things.

original: gnyi ga'i thun mong pa yin pas zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: gnyi ga'i thun mong pa yin pas zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning is that [the conventions of refutation and proof] are common to both [parties in a debate].

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i sgra'i don de la brten nas 'gro ba 'dir ni bsgrub pa dang dgag @201b pa thams cad kyang 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i sgra'i don de la brten nas 'gro ba 'dir ni bsgrub pa dang dgag @201b pa thams cad kyang 'dod pa yin no //
translated: Based on such referents of terms, all refutations and proofs in this world are accepted.

original: gal te tshad ma'i yul kho na sgra'i don ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te tshad ma'i yul kho na sgra'i don ma yin nam /
translated: If the referents of terms are only the objects of valid cognition,

original: de ci ltar na de la yang bsgrub ba dang dgag ba 'thad ce na /
analyzed: de ci ltar na de la yang bsgrub ba dang dgag ba 'thad ce na /
translated: how can refutation and proof be tenable with respect to them?

original: tshad ma'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshad ma'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: [The conventions of refutation and proof] are based on the objects of valid cognition.

original: mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i don ni /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i don ni /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúvalid cognition of direct perception‚Äù is

original: gsal ba'i rnam pa can shes ba'i bdag tu gyur par gsal ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gsal ba'i rnam pa can shes ba'i bdag tu gyur par gsal ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: that which is clear and has the nature of a cognition that is clear.

original: ci ltar gzhan yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar gzhan yin zhe na /
translated: How is it different?üîΩThe meaning of the term is

original: sgra'i don ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgra'i don ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of the term is as follows.

original: ci'i phyir gnyi ga la brten pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gnyi ga la brten pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not based on both?üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúvalid cognition‚Äù is

original: tshad ma'i don ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshad ma'i don ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of valid cognition is as follows.

original: rnam ba gzhan du ni dngos po las gzhan du'o //
analyzed: rnam ba gzhan du ni dngos po las gzhan du'o //
translated: In another way, it is different from the thing.

original: 'o na ci ltar sgra'i don gnyi ga'i thun mong ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar sgra'i don gnyi ga'i thun mong ba yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, how is the meaning of the term common to both?üîΩFrom the term

original: sgra las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgra las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: From the sound.üîΩüîΩ

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa des na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa des na /
translated: Since that is so,

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa la brten pa ni sgra'i don yin no //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa la brten pa ni sgra'i don yin no //
translated: the meaning of the term is based on both a thing and a non-thing.

original: mngon sum gyi don yang de 'dra ba kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi don yang de 'dra ba kho na'o zhe na /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúdirect perception‚Äù is just like that.

original: mngon sum gyi tshad ma ni rnam par rtog pa dang 'dra bar de lta min te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi tshad ma ni rnam par rtog pa dang 'dra bar de lta min te /
translated: But valid cognition of direct perception is not like that, like a conceptual cognition.

original: zhig pa dang ma zhig ba'i don la yang de 'dra ba nyid ma yin na gang gis de'i don las gnyi ga la thun mong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: zhig pa dang ma zhig ba'i don la yang de 'dra ba nyid ma yin na gang gis de'i don las gnyi ga la thun mong bar 'gyur /
translated: If the meaning of ‚Äúdisintegrated‚Äù and ‚Äúnot disintegrated‚Äù is not like that, then by what means would the meaning of both be established as common?

original: des na zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga la thun mong yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga la thun mong yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äú Thus‚Äù means because of being common to both.

original: de ltar rnam par rtog pa'i yul bsgrub pa dang dgag pa'i yul nyid du bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par rtog pa'i yul bsgrub pa dang dgag pa'i yul nyid du bsgrubs nas /
translated: Having thus established the object of conception as the object of affirmation and negation,

original: da ni rtog med kyi blo 'khrul ba'i yul zla ba gnyis la sogs pa yang dgag pa'i yul nyid du brjod pa ni /
analyzed: da ni rtog med kyi blo 'khrul ba'i yul zla ba gnyis la sogs pa yang dgag pa'i yul nyid du brjod pa ni /
translated: now, the object of nonconceptual mistaken consciousness, such as the two moons, is also expressed as the object of negation.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Even nonconceptual‚Äù is stated.

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa med pa'i shes pa mtha' dag tshad mar gyur na de'i tshe des nye bar bstan pa'i don dgag pa'i yul du mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa med pa'i shes pa mtha' dag tshad mar gyur na de'i tshe des nye bar bstan pa'i don dgag pa'i yul du mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If all nonconceptual consciousnesses were valid cognitions, then the object indicated by it would not be the object of negation.

original: de ltar ni ma yin te des na rnam par rtog pa med pa 'ga' zhig kho na tshad ma yin pa'i phyir de'i yul dgag ba'i yul du mi 'gyur mod 'khrul pa'i rnam pa gzhan dgag pa'i yul yin pa yang go 'gal ba ci yod /
analyzed: de ltar ni ma yin te des na rnam par rtog pa med pa 'ga' zhig kho na tshad ma yin pa'i phyir de'i yul dgag ba'i yul du mi 'gyur mod 'khrul pa'i rnam pa gzhan dgag pa'i yul yin pa yang go 'gal ba ci yod /
translated: But that is not so. Therefore, since only some non-conceptual cognitions are valid cognitions, it is not the case that their objects are objects of negation. But what contradiction is there in their being objects of negation that refute other aspects of error?

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa med pa sgrub pa'i tshul du zhugs pa na de'i don ji ltar dgag snyam na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa med pa sgrub pa'i tshul du zhugs pa na de'i don ji ltar dgag snyam na /
translated: If one asks, ‚ÄúWhen one engages in the mode of establishing non-conceptuality, how does one negate its object?‚Äù

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúIf . . .‚Äù

original: zla ba gnyis la sogs pa sgrub pa'i tshul du zhugs pa gang yin pa de tshad ma ma yin na ni de'i tshe tshad ma yin pa des na 'khrul pa'i shes pas nye bar bstan pa'i zla ba gnyis la sogs pa de tshad ma ma yin par bstan
analyzed: zla ba gnyis la sogs pa sgrub pa'i tshul du zhugs pa gang yin pa de tshad ma ma yin na ni de'i tshe tshad ma yin pa des na 'khrul pa'i shes pas nye bar bstan pa'i zla ba gnyis la sogs pa de tshad ma ma yin par bstan
translated: If that which engages in the mode of establishing the two moons and so on is not a valid cognition, then at that time it is a valid cognition. Therefore, the two moons and so on that are presented by a mistaken consciousness are not objects of negation.

original: pa'i phyir / zla ba gnyis la sogs pa 'di ni yod pa ma yin no zhes dgag pa 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: pa'i phyir / zla ba gnyis la sogs pa 'di ni yod pa ma yin no zhes dgag pa 'jug par byed do //
translated: In order to demonstrate that they are not objects of negation, he says, ‚ÄúThe two moons and so on do not exist.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe de tshad ma ma yin zhe na dgag pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba'o //üîΩgal te phyi rol gyi zla ba gnyis la sogs pa med pa'i rang bzhin dang zla ba gnyis la @202a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de tshad ma ma yin zhe na dgag pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba'o // gal te phyi rol gyi zla ba gnyis la sogs pa med pa'i rang bzhin dang zla ba gnyis la @202a * //
translated: If it is not valid cognition, then it is a negation.

original: sogs pa'i rnam par bsgrub pa 'jug pa yin na /
analyzed: sogs pa'i rnam par bsgrub pa 'jug pa yin na /
translated: If the cognition of two moons, etc. is engaged in establishing the nature of nonexistence of external two moons, etc.,

original: de'i tshe de tshad ma yin la gang gi tshe de tshad ma ma yin ba de'i tshe yang des nye bar bstan ba'i zla ba gnyis la sogs pa phyi'i zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi dgag pa yul nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to
analyzed: de'i tshe de tshad ma yin la gang gi tshe de tshad ma ma yin ba de'i tshe yang des nye bar bstan ba'i zla ba gnyis la sogs pa phyi'i zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi dgag pa yul nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to
translated: then at that time it is valid cognition. But when it is not valid cognition, then at that time, the negation of the nature of external two moons, etc., which is indicated by that cognition, is the object itself. This is the meaning.

original: // gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rtsod par ni don 'di yin te /
analyzed: // gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rtsod par ni don 'di yin te /
translated: The dispute beginning with ‚ÄúIf it is not valid cognition‚Äù has this meaning.

original: nyes pa 'khrul pa nyid nye bar skye ba ni /
analyzed: nyes pa 'khrul pa nyid nye bar skye ba ni /
translated: The arising of the error, the fault,

original: rang gi dmigs ba phyi rol gyi rang bzhin du med par ston par byed de /
analyzed: rang gi dmigs ba phyi rol gyi rang bzhin du med par ston par byed de /
translated: teaches that the object is not of the nature of external things.

original: des na btags zin ba la 'thag ba'i tshul du dgag pa gzhan gyis ni ci yang byar med do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na btags zin ba la 'thag ba'i tshul du dgag pa gzhan gyis ni ci yang byar med do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not possible to refute it by any other method, as if one were to refute what has already been designated.

original: de lta bu'i nyid du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de lta bu'i nyid du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In this way alone means

original: phyi'i dmigs pas stong pa kho nar ro //
analyzed: phyi'i dmigs pas stong pa kho nar ro //
translated: that it is empty of an external object.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rang rig pa zhes bya ba'o 'di nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa ni rang gi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang rig pa zhes bya ba'o 'di nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa ni rang gi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because of the statement self-awareness. This is the establishment of the treatise.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gzhan gyis so //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gzhan gyis so //
translated: Otherwise means by another mode.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: thug pa med pas rang gi ngo bos las dams  par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thug pa med pas rang gi ngo bos las dams  par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the fallacy of the infinite regress of self-awareness.

original: gang gis rang gis ngo bo las nyams par 'gyur ba ci ltar thug pa med ce na /
analyzed: gang gis rang gis ngo bo las nyams par 'gyur ba ci ltar thug pa med ce na /
translated: If it is asked, How is there an infinite regress of self-awareness?

original: rnam pa gzhan du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said, by another mode.üîΩ If it is asked, What is that?

original: de nyid kyang zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gzhan no //
analyzed: de nyid kyang zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gzhan no //
translated: It is said, by another mode.

original: 'on te rnam pa gnyis pa yang rnam pa gzhan du snang ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rnam pa gnyis pa yang rnam pa gzhan du snang ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, Is the second mode also an appearance by another mode?

original: der yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: der yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is said, in that case.

original: rnam pa gnyis pa la yang rnam pa gzhan du snang ba yin na /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis pa la yang rnam pa gzhan du snang ba yin na /
translated: In the second case, if it appears in another aspect,

original: de ltar zhes bya ba rang bzhin de nyid yin par 'gyur ba'i phyir thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba rang bzhin de nyid yin par 'gyur ba'i phyir thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would be that very nature, and so there would be an infinite regress.

original: dngos po nye bar len ba can nyid kyang dgag par mi 'thad do zhes brjod pa'i don du rang gi ngo bor zhes smras so //
analyzed: dngos po nye bar len ba can nyid kyang dgag par mi 'thad do zhes brjod pa'i don du rang gi ngo bor zhes smras so //
translated: And it is not tenable to refute the possession of a thing, as has been stated in order to express the meaning of the statement ‚Äúin its own nature.‚Äù

original: gal te chos can yin na /
analyzed: gal te chos can yin na /
translated: If it is a subject,

original: de'i tshe phyi rol gyi nye bar len pa can yin pa 'gog par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes de ltar ni sangs rgyas pas kyang khas blang dgos so //
analyzed: de'i tshe phyi rol gyi nye bar len pa can yin pa 'gog par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes de ltar ni sangs rgyas pas kyang khas blang dgos so //
translated: then the Buddhist must accept that the possession of an external object is refuted, but not anything else.

original: 'on te chos can yod pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te chos can yod pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: But if the subject exists,

original: chos can de yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: chos can de yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: then that subject,

original: sgra'i don gyi rang bzhin /
analyzed: sgra'i don gyi rang bzhin /
translated: the nature of the meaning of the word,

original: dngos po'i nye bar len pa can dgag pa'i gzhir gyur pa yang rang gi ngo bos zhes bya ba dngos po'i nye bar len pa can ma yin pa'i rang bzhin du rtogs pas na ste /
analyzed: dngos po'i nye bar len pa can dgag pa'i gzhir gyur pa yang rang gi ngo bos zhes bya ba dngos po'i nye bar len pa can ma yin pa'i rang bzhin du rtogs pas na ste /
translated: The basis of refutation, which is the appropriator of a thing, is understood to be essentially the non-appropriator of a thing.

original: dngos po'i nye bar len pa can ma yin pa ni de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po'i nye bar len pa can ma yin pa ni de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the non-appropriator of a thing is its essence,

original: chos can rtogs pa nyid na dngos po'i nye bar len pa can ma yin par rtog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos can rtogs pa nyid na dngos po'i nye bar len pa can ma yin par rtog par 'gyur ro //
translated: when the subject is understood, it is understood to be the non-appropriator of a thing.üîΩTherefore, how could it be that the subject is common to both the affirmation and the negation?

original: des na ci ltar chos can de sgrub pa dang dgag pa'i thun mong pa nyid yin zhen @202b sgra'i don dang mtshungs pa de 'dra ba phyi rol dang nang gi rang bzhin med na'ang /
analyzed: des na ci ltar chos can de sgrub pa dang dgag pa'i thun mong pa nyid yin zhen @202b sgra'i don dang mtshungs pa de 'dra ba phyi rol dang nang gi rang bzhin med na'ang /
translated: Even though the external and internal natures that are similar to the meaning of the words do not exist,

original: sgra'i don gyi rang bzhin gyi chos can de nyid sgrub pa dang dgag pa de dag dang 'brel bar snang zhing nges ba yin gyi /
analyzed: sgra'i don gyi rang bzhin gyi chos can de nyid sgrub pa dang dgag pa de dag dang 'brel bar snang zhing nges ba yin gyi /
translated: the subject, which is the nature of the meaning of the words, appears and is ascertained to be related to those affirmations and negations.

original: phyi dang nang gi rang bzhin dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi rang bzhin dag ni ma yin no //
translated: But the external and internal natures are not.

original: gal te phyi dang nang gi rang bzhin dang bral ba nyid yin na rang bzhin med pa kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te phyi dang nang gi rang bzhin dang bral ba nyid yin na rang bzhin med pa kho na ma yin nam /
translated: If it is devoid of internal and external natures, then it is surely natureless.

original: ci ltar na yod ces tha snyad byed snyam na sgra 'jug pa'i gtan tshigs la /
analyzed: ci ltar na yod ces tha snyad byed snyam na sgra 'jug pa'i gtan tshigs la /
translated: How can it be said to exist?

original: sgra'i don gyi rang bzhin gyi gzhan sel bde yang spyi la sogs brjod par bya ba yin par 'dzin pa bzlog pa'i don du yod do zhes bya ba'i tha snyad la brten par 'dod do //
analyzed: sgra'i don gyi rang bzhin gyi gzhan sel bde yang spyi la sogs brjod par bya ba yin par 'dzin pa bzlog pa'i don du yod do zhes bya ba'i tha snyad la brten par 'dod do //
translated: The reason for the use of the term is this: the exclusion of other, which is the nature of the referent of a term, is also said to be a universal, etc. The term ‚Äúexists‚Äù is used in order to refute the notion that it is a real entity.

original: ci'i phyir tha snyad 'di phyi dang nang gi rang bzhin la brten pa ma yin zhen /
analyzed: ci'i phyir tha snyad 'di phyi dang nang gi rang bzhin la brten pa ma yin zhen /
translated: Why is this term not based on internal and external natures?

original: sgra zhes bya ba'o de las zhes bya ba ni phyi dang nang gi rang bzhin las ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: sgra zhes bya ba'o de las zhes bya ba ni phyi dang nang gi rang bzhin las ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúsound‚Äù is used to refer to the exclusion of other, which is not based on internal and external natures.

original: lan ni gzhan sel ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni gzhan sel ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is ‚Äúthe exclusion of other.‚Äù

original: 'o na sgra las rtogs ba zhes bya ba'i tha snyad du ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na sgra las rtogs ba zhes bya ba'i tha snyad du ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But how can the term ‚Äúunderstood from sound‚Äù be used?

original: de lta na yang zhes bya ba ste ma rtogs na yang ngo //
analyzed: de lta na yang zhes bya ba ste ma rtogs na yang ngo //
translated: Even though it is not understood,

original: de ga las shen 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ga las shen 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
translated: How do we know that? It is like this.

original: mngon par yin no zhes bya ba ni lhag par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par yin no zhes bya ba ni lhag par zhen pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Manifestly‚Äù means ‚Äúexcessively.‚Äù

original: ci ltar na sgra'i don 'di phyi rol la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar na sgra'i don 'di phyi rol la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that the meaning of the word is devoid of the nature of external objects, etc.?

original: de skad du yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de skad du yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú In this way‚Äù means ‚Äúin that way.‚Äù

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni gzhan sel ba la'o //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni gzhan sel ba la'o //
translated: ‚Äú In this case‚Äù means ‚Äúin the case of the exclusion of other.‚Äù

original: slob dpon chos mchog gi lugs kyi dogs pa bsu ba ni ;
analyzed: slob dpon chos mchog gi lugs kyi dogs pa bsu ba ni ;
translated: The objection according to the system of Master Paramartha is as follows.

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú If‚Äù means ‚Äúin that case.‚Äù

original: gang la shes pa las phyi rol gyi rang bzhin du sgro btags pa'i rang bzhin yod pa de lta bu sgra'i don gyi rang bzhin yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gang la shes pa las phyi rol gyi rang bzhin du sgro btags pa'i rang bzhin yod pa de lta bu sgra'i don gyi rang bzhin yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: ‚Äú Is not the nature of the meaning of the word existent, in the sense of being the nature of an external object imputed by consciousness?‚Äù

original: des na sgra'i don rang bzhin med pa ci ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: des na sgra'i don rang bzhin med pa ci ltar yin zhe na /
translated: ‚Äú How then is the meaning of the word nonexistent?‚Äù

original: lan ni de la ni phyi rol gyi rang bzhin du sgro btags pa'i rang bzhin yod pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: lan ni de la ni phyi rol gyi rang bzhin du sgro btags pa'i rang bzhin yod pa ma yin no ;
translated: The answer is: ‚ÄúIn that case, the nature of the meaning of the word is not existent in the sense of being the nature of an external object imputed by consciousness.‚Äù

original: / ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: / ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: shes pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Because of the consciousness‚Äù and so on.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni sgro btags pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni sgro btags pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The other is the nature of superimposition.

original: dogs pa ni 'khrul pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dogs pa ni 'khrul pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The doubt is the error.

original: sgro btags pa'i rang gi ngo bo ni 'khrul ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgro btags pa'i rang gi ngo bo ni 'khrul ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The nature of superimposition is error.

original: lan ni de yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lan ni de yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The reply is: That also is the nature of error.

original: 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin yang ngo //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin yang ngo //
translated: The nature of superimposition is also the nature of error.

original: ma rtogs na zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: ma rtogs na zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: If it is not understood, it is the nature of error.

original: dogs pa ni phyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dogs pa ni phyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The doubt is: later.

original: dang po'i ni 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin rtogs pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: dang po'i ni 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin rtogs pa kho na yin la /
translated: The first is the nature of error.

original: phyis ni 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin nyid du nges par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyis ni 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin nyid du nges par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Later, it is ascertained as the nature of error.

original: rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin du'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin du'o //
translated: The nature is the nature of error.

original: ma rtogs na ni @203a * //
analyzed: ma rtogs na ni @203a * //
translated: If it is not understood,

original: 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin du yod do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin du yod do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: it exists as the nature of error.

original: rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de'i yul ci ltar yin /
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de'i yul ci ltar yin /
translated: What is the object of that determination?

original: 'on te dang bo ni 'khrul ba'i rang bzhin la /
analyzed: 'on te dang bo ni 'khrul ba'i rang bzhin la /
translated: Or, is the first the nature of error?

original: ma 'khrul ba nyid du rtogs te /
analyzed: ma 'khrul ba nyid du rtogs te /
translated: It is understood to be non-erroneous.

original: des 'khrul ba nyid du nges pa ma yin no zhes dogs na gzhan gyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des 'khrul ba nyid du nges pa ma yin no zhes dogs na gzhan gyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you doubt that it is ascertained as erroneous, then there is the other.

original: gal te de nyid gzhan gyi rang gi ngo bor rtog na /
analyzed: gal te de nyid gzhan gyi rang gi ngo bor rtog na /
translated: If that itself is imagined to be the nature of the other,

original: de'i tshe rtogs pa 'khrul par 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i tshe rtogs pa 'khrul par 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: then the understanding would be erroneous.

original: sgro btags pa de nyid ni 'khrul ba'i rang bzhin du rtags ba ma yin no //
analyzed: sgro btags pa de nyid ni 'khrul ba'i rang bzhin du rtags ba ma yin no //
translated: But the superimposition itself is not understood to be of the nature of error.

original: bden pa nyid du nges pas na zhes bya ba ni sgro btags pa mi bden yang dang po bden pa nyid du snang pas na'o //
analyzed: bden pa nyid du nges pas na zhes bya ba ni sgro btags pa mi bden yang dang po bden pa nyid du snang pas na'o //
translated: Because it is ascertained as true, even though the superimposition is not true, it appears as true in the beginning.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni lan no /
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni lan no /
translated: The answer to that is ‚Äúthat‚Äù.

original: dogs pa ni don la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dogs pa ni don la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The doubt is ‚Äúin the object‚Äù.

original: lan ni de nyid ces bya ba ste don la ma reg pa nyid do //
analyzed: lan ni de nyid ces bya ba ste don la ma reg pa nyid do //
translated: The answer is ‚Äúthat itself‚Äù, which is not touching the object.

original: de'i ni sgro btags pa yi'o //
analyzed: de'i ni sgro btags pa yi'o //
translated: That is the superimposition.

original: don la ma reg pa de yang snang ba kho na yin pas ci ltar mi bden pas /
analyzed: don la ma reg pa de yang snang ba kho na yin pas ci ltar mi bden pas /
translated: Since that not touching the object is only an appearance, how is it not true?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said ‚Äúby nature‚Äù.

original: don la ma reg kyang don la reg pa nyid du nges pa skyed pa'i phyir mi bden pa nyid do zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: don la ma reg kyang don la reg pa nyid du nges pa skyed pa'i phyir mi bden pa nyid do zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: Although it does not touch the object, it generates the certainty that it does touch the object. Therefore, it is not true.

original: rnam pa gzhan du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to the qualm is ‚ÄúOtherwise. . . .‚Äù

original: lan ni 'on zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni 'on zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is ‚ÄúNo. . . .‚Äù

original: nyid kyi tshig gis ni don la ma reg pa bden par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: nyid kyi tshig gis ni don la ma reg pa bden par brjod pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúitself‚Äù indicates that the non-contact with the object is true.

original: dogs pa ni des zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dogs pa ni des zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The qualm is ‚ÄúBy that. . . .‚Äù

original: sgro btags pas phyin ci log tu nges pa skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgro btags pas phyin ci log tu nges pa skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The superimposition generates the certainty that is erroneous.

original: de yang ni sgro btags pa'o //
analyzed: de yang ni sgro btags pa'o //
translated: The superimposition is also that.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni lan no mngon sum la snang ba nges pa skyed par byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du sgro btags pa yang de'i skyed byed ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni lan no mngon sum la snang ba nges pa skyed par byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du sgro btags pa yang de'i skyed byed ma yin gyi /
translated: The response is ‚ÄúNo. . . .‚Äù Just as the appearance in perception does not generate certainty, in the same way, the superimposition also does not generate it.

original: 'on kyang sgro btags pa nyid de skyed byed yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang sgro btags pa nyid de skyed byed yin no //
translated: However, the superimposition itself generates it.

original: gang gis de skyed pas de'ang mi bden par 'gyur ba nges pa yang 'khrul pa ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: gang gis de skyed pas de'ang mi bden par 'gyur ba nges pa yang 'khrul pa ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: Since it generates that, it is not true. The certainty that is generated is not an error.

original: de lta yin na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta yin na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúIf that were so. . . .‚Äù

original: de yang ni nges pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de yang ni nges pa yang ngo //
translated: And that is also the ascertainment.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni shes pa dang shes bya las ma gtogs pa'i sgro btags ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni shes pa dang shes bya las ma gtogs pa'i sgro btags ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore means because there is no superimposition apart from the object of knowledge and the knower.

original: gzung ba'i rnam pa dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'ba' zhig yod kyi btags pa gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam pa dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'ba' zhig yod kyi btags pa gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that there is only the conception that possesses the aspect of the apprehended, but there is no other superimposition.

original: gal te rang bzhin med na /
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin med na /
translated: If there is no intrinsic reality,

original: 'o na ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then how is it?

original: lan ni sgra 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni sgra 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is because of the engagement of terms.

original: 'di nyid kyi bshad pa ni sgra 'jug pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi bshad pa ni sgra 'jug pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of this is because of the engagement of terms.

original: tha snyad las zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tha snyad las zhes bya ba ni /
translated: From convention means

original: bsgrub pa dang dgag pa'i rang bzhin las so //
analyzed: bsgrub pa dang dgag pa'i rang bzhin las so //
translated: from the nature of affirmation and negation.

original: ci'i don du zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i don du zhe na /
translated: For what purpose?

original: spyi la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyi la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: For the sake of the understanding of the general and so on.

original: gal te sgra las ci yang @203b rtogs pa med do zhes brjod kyang spyi la sogs par 'dzin pa ni ldog par 'gyur ba nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te sgra las ci yang @203b rtogs pa med do zhes brjod kyang spyi la sogs par 'dzin pa ni ldog par 'gyur ba nyid ma yin nam /
translated: If it is said that nothing is understood from a term, then is not the apprehension of the general and so on eliminated?

original: des na gzhan sel ba zhes bstan pas ci bya zhe na /
analyzed: des na gzhan sel ba zhes bstan pas ci bya zhe na /
translated: Therefore, what is the point of teaching ‚Äúexclusion of other‚Äù?

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúIf you say . . .‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir sgra 'jug pa'i phyir yod do zhes tha snyad du byed pa de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgra 'jug pa'i phyir yod do zhes tha snyad du byed pa de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Since the term exists is used because the term is used,

original: rnam 'grel mdzad pas de yang zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam 'grel mdzad pas de yang zhes gsungs te /
translated: the author of the Commentary says ‚Äúthat too.‚Äù

original: sgra'i don rang bzhin med pa nyid bsgrub pa dang / dgag pa'i tha snyad la brten par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra'i don rang bzhin med pa nyid bsgrub pa dang / dgag pa'i tha snyad la brten par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: He asserts that the meaning of the term is established as essenceless and that it is based on the conventions of negation.

original: de ltar ma yin na zhes bya ba ni de'i tha snyad la brten par mi 'dod na /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na zhes bya ba ni de'i tha snyad la brten par mi 'dod na /
translated: If it were not so, that is, if it were not asserted that it is based on that convention,

original: rang bzhin med pa sgra'i don yin pa la shes par byed pa med pa'i phyir na yod do zhes bya ba'i tha snyad chad pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa sgra'i don yin pa la shes par byed pa med pa'i phyir na yod do zhes bya ba'i tha snyad chad pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: since there would be no way to understand that the meaning of the term is essenceless, the convention ‚Äúexists‚Äù would be completely eliminated.

original: des na rigs pa can la sogs pa sgra'i don rang bzhin med pa ci ltar yin zhes spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na rigs pa can la sogs pa sgra'i don rang bzhin med pa ci ltar yin zhes spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the NaiyƒÅyikas and so on would reject the claim that the meaning of the term is essenceless.

original: gal te sgro btags pa mi bden yang rang bzhin med par sgra'i don ci ltar yin te /
analyzed: gal te sgro btags pa mi bden yang rang bzhin med par sgra'i don ci ltar yin te /
translated: If superimposition is not true, how could the meaning of the term be essenceless?

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin brjod bya yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin brjod bya yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because the nature of the thing is the content of the expression.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is like this.

original: gang gi phyir me'i sgra las me ma yin pa las ldog pa ma ldog kyang /
analyzed: gang gi phyir me'i sgra las me ma yin pa las ldog pa ma ldog kyang /
translated: Even though the word fire does not exclude non-fire,

original: me ma yin pa spangs nas 'jug pa nyid gzhan bzlog pa yin no //
analyzed: me ma yin pa spangs nas 'jug pa nyid gzhan bzlog pa yin no //
translated: it does exclude other things, since it is applied by excluding non-fire.

original: 'on te 'di 'dra ba'i gzhan bzlog pa ni /
analyzed: 'on te 'di 'dra ba'i gzhan bzlog pa ni /
translated: But if you say that the exclusion of other things like this

original: sgra las dngos po'i rang bzhin rtogs pa'i dbang gis 'gyur ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: sgra las dngos po'i rang bzhin rtogs pa'i dbang gis 'gyur ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: is not due to the understanding of the nature of the thing from the word,

original: rtogs pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then it is because of the understanding.

original: phan tshun gyi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phan tshun gyi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The word each other

original: sgras ni gzhan las ldog pa'i rnam par rtog pa skyes la des ni 'jug pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sgras ni gzhan las ldog pa'i rnam par rtog pa skyes la des ni 'jug pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: means that the word produces the conceptual thought that excludes other things, and that conceptual thought produces the conceptual thought that applies.

original: 'on te me'i sgra las me'i rang bzhin rtogs pa nyid kyi na 'jug pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te me'i sgra las me'i rang bzhin rtogs pa nyid kyi na 'jug pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the word fire is applied because it is the understanding of the nature of fire,

original: sgra las ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgra las ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then it is from the word.

original: de las ni zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa las so //
analyzed: de las ni zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa las so //
translated: From that means from the conceptual thought.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni bdag 'jug go zhes bya ba'i rnam ba can no //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni bdag 'jug go zhes bya ba'i rnam ba can no //
translated: The conceptual differentiation of engagement is the form ‚ÄúI am engaged.‚Äù

original: de las zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'i rnam par rtog pa las so //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'i rnam par rtog pa las so //
translated: From that means from the conceptual differentiation of engagement.

original: 'gro ba'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni yul gzhan dang gzhan du skye ba'i chos can gyi lus nyid 'gro ba po yin la /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni yul gzhan dang gzhan du skye ba'i chos can gyi lus nyid 'gro ba po yin la /
translated: The nature of going means that the body itself, which has the property of being born in different places, is the goer.

original: de'i rang bzhin nyams su myong ba po zhes bya ba nang gi reg bya lus kyi dbang pos nyams su myong ba'o //üîΩ'gro ba'i rang bzhin nyams su myong ba de las ni yod na me thob pa'am /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin nyams su myong ba po zhes bya ba nang gi reg bya lus kyi dbang pos nyams su myong ba'o // 'gro ba'i rang bzhin nyams su myong ba de las ni yod na me thob pa'am /
translated: The experience of the nature of going is the experience of the internal tactile object by the body faculty.üîΩFrom the experience of the nature of going, when it exists, the acquisition of fire, or, if it does not exist, the non-acquisition of fire, is like that.

original: gal te med na mi thob pa zhes bya ba de lta bur me'i rang bzhin ma gtogs pas kho nar tha snyad yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te med na mi thob pa zhes bya ba de lta bur me'i rang bzhin ma gtogs pas kho nar tha snyad yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: In this way, the conventional is completely fulfilled, except for the nature of fire.üîΩFor this very reason, it is said:

original: de nyid kyi phyir brjod par bya ba dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir brjod par bya ba dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe object of expression,
although it does not exist,

original: mod kyi de lta na yang tha snyad ni 'grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mod kyi de lta na yang tha snyad ni 'grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: nevertheless, the conventional is established.‚Äù This is the meaning.

original: des na sgra'i don ni rang bzhin med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na sgra'i don ni rang bzhin med pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the word is just essencelessness.

original: gal te sgra'i don dngos bo'i rang bzhin nyid kyis ngo bo dang bcas pa yin na ci skyon snyam na /
analyzed: gal te sgra'i don dngos bo'i rang bzhin nyid kyis ngo bo dang bcas pa yin na ci skyon snyam na /
translated: If the meaning of the word were to have an essence by virtue of the essence of the thing, what would be the problem?

original: de lta min na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta min na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means that it would not be so.

original: gal te sgra'i don rang bzhin med pa ma yin gyi ;
analyzed: gal te sgra'i don rang bzhin med pa ma yin gyi ;
translated: If the meaning of the word were not essenceless,

original: 'on kyang dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid yin na /
