original: gal te 'di'o zhes bya ba'i shes pa mngon sum gyi de ma thag tu 'byung ba yang sgra'i don gyi yul can yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa can ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te 'di'o zhes bya ba'i shes pa mngon sum gyi de ma thag tu 'byung ba yang sgra'i don gyi yul can yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa can ma yin nam /
translated: If the cognition that arises immediately after the cognition of the word is the cognition of the object, then it is conceptual, because it has as its object the meaning of the word.

original: ci ltar yid kyi mngon sum du brjod ce na /üîΩmngon sum gyi zhes bya ba'o //üîΩ'dir zhes bya ba'i rnam pa can dngos po'i rnam par rtog pas ni /
analyzed: ci ltar yid kyi mngon sum du brjod ce na / mngon sum gyi zhes bya ba'o // 'dir zhes bya ba'i rnam pa can dngos po'i rnam par rtog pas ni /
translated: How can it be a direct perception of the mind?üîΩIt is a direct perception, because it is a direct perception.

original: sngon po rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon po rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: The conceptual cognition that has the form ‚Äúthis‚Äù does not cognize the object.

original: sngon po ci 'dra ba zhig rtogs pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: sngon po ci 'dra ba zhig rtogs pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that it does not cognize the object?

original: sgra'i yul gyi sngon po'o //
analyzed: sgra'i yul gyi sngon po'o //
translated: It does not cognize the object as it is, because it has as its object the word that is the referent of the word.

original: @211a * // 'on kyang des ni mngon sum kho na rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: @211a * // 'on kyang des ni mngon sum kho na rtogs pa yin no //
translated: However, it does cognize the object directly.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa yin no //
translated: For that very reason, it is nonconceptual.

original: dngos po'i rnam par rtog pas zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa smra ba'i bsam pa'i dbang gis brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i rnam par rtog pas zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa smra ba'i bsam pa'i dbang gis brjod pa yin no //
translated: The expression ‚Äúconceptual cognition of the object‚Äù is used because of the intention of the one who is arguing.

original: 'o na yid kyi mngon sum gyi rang bzhin ci 'dra ba zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na yid kyi mngon sum gyi rang bzhin ci 'dra ba zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of direct perception of the mind?

original: de 'di zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de 'di zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is that which is this.

original: des zhes bya ba ni yid kyi mngon sum du mngon par 'dod pas so //üîΩmngon sum yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma nyid dam /
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni yid kyi mngon sum du mngon par 'dod pas so // mngon sum yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma nyid dam /
translated: ‚ÄúBy that‚Äù means by mental perception, which is accepted.

original: yang na yid kyi mngon sum du mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: yang na yid kyi mngon sum du mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is perception‚Äù means that it is momentary, or else it is accepted as mental perception.

original: 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not a negation‚Äù means that it is not a negation.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sgra dang rnam par rtog pa dag gzhan sel ba'i yul can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sgra dang rnam par rtog pa dag gzhan sel ba'i yul can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means because sound and conceptual thought do not have the exclusion of other as their object.

original: tha dad pa'i don ces bya ba ni thams cad ldog pa'i phyi rol gyi don gzhan las ldog pa la ni /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i don ces bya ba ni thams cad ldog pa'i phyi rol gyi don gzhan las ldog pa la ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThe meaning of difference‚Äù means that in the exclusion of other external objects, all are included.

original: thams cad ces bya ba gzhi mthun pa la sogs pa 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba gzhi mthun pa la sogs pa 'thad pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúAll‚Äù means that common locus and so on are tenable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de nyid ces bya ba ste don nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ste don nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúThat itself‚Äù means the object itself.

original: gal te don dam par na log pa las ldog pa gzhan kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te don dam par na log pa las ldog pa gzhan kho na ma yin nam /
translated: If in reality it is not just the exclusion of non-x,

original: des na ci ltar gzhi mthun pa la sogs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des na ci ltar gzhi mthun pa la sogs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: then how can there be a common locus and so on?

original: ldog pa ni don de las gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: ldog pa ni don de las gzhan ma yin te /
translated: The exclusion is not other than that object.

original: ngo bo med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: gal te ldog pa gzhan ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te ldog pa gzhan ma yin na /
translated: If the exclusions are not different,

original: 'o na ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then how is it that?

original: lan ni dper na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni dper na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is: for example,

original: ldog pa rnams zhes bya ni gcig la gnas pa rnams so //
analyzed: ldog pa rnams zhes bya ni gcig la gnas pa rnams so //
translated: the exclusions are said to be those that abide in one.

original: de nyid gzhung 'jug pa ni ldog pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid gzhung 'jug pa ni ldog pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That very text is engaged: the exclusions,

original: kun rdzob tu ni rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis so //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis so //
translated: conventionally, by the power of conceptualization.

original: de min zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa nyid do //
analyzed: de min zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa nyid do //
translated: Not that, means they are not different.

original: gang gi phyir da ltar tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa des na rnam par rtog pa'i yul gyi sgra'i don ni tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa'i rgyu mtshan yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir da ltar tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa des na rnam par rtog pa'i yul gyi sgra'i don ni tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa'i rgyu mtshan yin te /
translated: Because they are now different and not different, the meaning of the word that is the object of conceptualization is the reason for being different and not different.

original: sgra'i don med na tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin mad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sgra'i don med na tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin mad pa'i phyir te /
translated: If the meaning of the word does not exist, the nature of being different and not different does not exist,

original: rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: phyed snga ma 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: phyed snga ma 'chad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the first half is:

original: don dam pa la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don dam pa la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: in the ultimate,

original: de dag ces bya ba ni ldog pa rnams so //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni ldog pa rnams so //
translated: those means the exclusions.

original: gnyi ga'i zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBoth‚Äù means both different and not different.

original: ci ltar kun rdzob tu yang tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: ci ltar kun rdzob tu yang tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa nyid du 'gyur /
translated: How could there be difference and non-difference even conventionally?

original: nye bar bslad ba nyid du ma nges par yang ci ste zhe na /
analyzed: nye bar bslad ba nyid du ma nges par yang ci ste zhe na /
translated: Why is it not ascertained as just a superimposition?

original: 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus, he says,

original: don zhes bya ba ni chos can ni /
analyzed: don zhes bya ba ni chos can ni /
translated: ‚Äúobject‚Äù is the subject.

original: de zhes bya ba nyan pa'i rnam par shes pa'i 'bras bu can no //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba nyan pa'i rnam par shes pa'i 'bras bu can no //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù is the result of the auditory consciousness.

original: 'di ni 'phel ba'i rnam par bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni 'phel ba'i rnam par bstan to //
translated: This shows the mode of increase.

original: de 'bras med ces bya ba @211b ni mig la sogs pa'i shes pa'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: de 'bras med ces bya ba @211b ni mig la sogs pa'i shes pa'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIt has no result‚Äù means it is not the result of visual consciousness, etc.

original: 'dis ni 'grib pa'i rnam pa brjod do //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'grib pa'i rnam pa brjod do //
translated: This expresses the mode of decrease.

original: gcig ces bya ba 'dis ni gzhi mthun pa'i rgyu mtshan tha dad pa med pa nyid brjod pa'o //
analyzed: gcig ces bya ba 'dis ni gzhi mthun pa'i rgyu mtshan tha dad pa med pa nyid brjod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOne‚Äù expresses the non-difference of the common basis.

original: de zhes bya ba de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa dag las de'i 'bras bu can nyid kyis tha dad pa dang / de las zhes bya ba de'i 'bras bu can dag la de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa nyid kyis tha dad pa ste 'dis ni sgra tha dad pa 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan tha dad pa nyid brjod pa yin no //üîΩde lta bur gyur ba'i chos can de yang sgra yang rnam par rtog pa tha dad rten can de ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan can de lta bur gyur pa'i don de la 'phel ba dang 'grib pa lta bur byed pa dngos po'i rang bzhin ma rtogs pas na nye
analyzed: de zhes bya ba de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa dag las de'i 'bras bu can nyid kyis tha dad pa dang / de las zhes bya ba de'i 'bras bu can dag la de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa nyid kyis tha dad pa ste 'dis ni sgra tha dad pa 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan tha dad pa nyid brjod pa yin no // de lta bur gyur ba'i chos can de yang sgra yang rnam par rtog pa tha dad rten can de ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan can de lta bur gyur pa'i don de la 'phel ba dang 'grib pa lta bur byed pa dngos po'i rang bzhin ma rtogs pas na nye
translated: The word that is different from those that are not its effects by being its effect, and the word from that is different from those that are its effects by not being its effect. This expresses the difference in the reason for the application of different words.üîΩThat characterized, which is like that, is the basis of different conceptual differences. The reason for its reversal is that it is like that. That object, which is like that, is applied to the characteristic of a different conceptual difference by the cause of the appearance of increase and decrease, as if it were the nature of things, due to not understanding the nature of things.

original: bar bslad par gyur pa'i bslad pa de dang de dag gis don dam par 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dang bral ba yin yang ma thong ba tha dad par gyur pa'i mtshan nyid du nye bar sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: bar bslad par gyur pa'i bslad pa de dang de dag gis don dam par 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dang bral ba yin yang ma thong ba tha dad par gyur pa'i mtshan nyid du nye bar sbyor ba yin no //
translated: By those corruptions that are thus corrupted, that is, by those corruptions that are thus corrupted by the cause of the appearance of increase and decrease, that ultimate reality, which is free from increase and decrease, is applied to the characteristic of a different conceptual difference, due to not understanding the nature of things.

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa'i yul gyi don ci ltar 'thob pa nyid du sbyor zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa'i yul gyi don ci ltar 'thob pa nyid du sbyor zhe na /
translated: If one asks how the object of conceptualization is connected to the attainment of the object,

original: 'brel pa 'ga' las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa 'ga' las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: [the answer is:] ‚Äúfrom some connection.‚Äù

original: rnam par rtog pa'i khyad par gyi yul ni /üîΩthob par bya ba'i don dang lhan cig de'i bdag nyid dam /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i khyad par gyi yul ni / thob par bya ba'i don dang lhan cig de'i bdag nyid dam /
translated: The object of a particular conceptualizationüîΩexists as having a connection with the object to be attained, either by the nature of being the same entity as it,

original: de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yod pa kho na'o //
translated: or by the nature of arising from it.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: de bdag de las byung ba yi//
analyzed: de bdag de las byung ba yi//
translated: ‚ÄúBy the power of that nature and that arising,

original: mthu yis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mthu yis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: it is said to be ‚Äòfrom that.‚Äô‚Äù

original: des na tha snyad de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung bas 'brel ba'i phyir mthong ba nyid du sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: des na tha snyad de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung bas 'brel ba'i phyir mthong ba nyid du sbyor ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, because of the connection of the conventional with that nature and that arising, it is connected to what is seen.

original: gang gi phyir yang dag ma yin yang yang dag pa lta bur ston par byed pa des rnam par rtog pa'am sgra'am tha snyad du byed pa de bslad pa nyid kyang shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yang dag ma yin yang yang dag pa lta bur ston par byed pa des rnam par rtog pa'am sgra'am tha snyad du byed pa de bslad pa nyid kyang shes pa ma yin te /
translated: Even though it is not real, it appears as if it were real. Therefore, when one engages in conceptualization, speech, or conventional activity, one does not know that it is distorted.

original: 'brel pa yod na de las zhugs pa de lta na'i dngos po la mi slu ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa yod na de las zhugs pa de lta na'i dngos po la mi slu ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If there were a relation, then there would be non-deception in regard to the thing, because of the engagement in that.

original: rnam 'grel snga ma'i don dang / rnam 'grel gnyis pa 'di'i don gyi 'grel pa bya ba'i phyir dgos par byed pa ni /
analyzed: rnam 'grel snga ma'i don dang / rnam 'grel gnyis pa 'di'i don gyi 'grel pa bya ba'i phyir dgos par byed pa ni /
translated: The purpose of the commentary is to explain the meaning of the earlier commentary and the meaning of this second commentary.

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word if is the purpose.

original: 'di nyid ci ltar ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid ci ltar ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The word this itself is

original: rnam par ma brtags par khas len pa'o ;
analyzed: rnam par ma brtags par khas len pa'o ;
translated: the acceptance without analysis.

original: / mthong bar sbyor zhes bya ba 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: / mthong bar sbyor zhes bya ba 'chad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of in the engagement of seeing is

original: mi slu ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi slu ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because of non-deception.

original: bslad pa'ang shes pa ma yin zhes bya bar 'chad pa ni mi rtag go zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bslad pa'ang shes pa ma yin zhes bya bar 'chad pa ni mi rtag go zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of the adulterated is not knowledge is impermanent.

original: 'di nyid brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid brjod pa ni /
translated: This is stated

original: tha dad tha dad med ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha dad tha dad med ces bya ba'o //
translated: as different and not different.

original: don bya ba grub na tha dad pa dang tha mi dad ba la nga'i slu bzhugs so zhes bya ba'i @212a * //
analyzed: don bya ba grub na tha dad pa dang tha mi dad ba la nga'i slu bzhugs so zhes bya ba'i @212a * //
translated: When the performance of the object is accomplished, there is non-deception in regard to the different and the not different.

original: rnam par dpyad pa gang du dgos pa soms shig / tha dad pa'i chos kyis don bya ba 'grub pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par dpyad pa gang du dgos pa soms shig / tha dad pa'i chos kyis don bya ba 'grub pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: It is not the case that a different property accomplishes the object‚Äôs function.

original: bur ma zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bur ma zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is the ‚Äúsugar‚Äù example.

original: bur ma la tha dad pa'i mngar bas ni mngar ba'i don byed pa yin par ni 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bur ma la tha dad pa'i mngar bas ni mngar ba'i don byed pa yin par ni 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not tenable that sugar‚Äôs sweetness, which is different from sugar, accomplishes the function of sweetness.

original: bu ram gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i mngar ba kho nas don bya ba byed par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bu ram gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i mngar ba kho nas don bya ba byed par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because we see that only the sweetness that is the nature of sugar accomplishes the function.

original: des na tha dad pa tshol ba ni don med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na tha dad pa tshol ba ni don med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it is pointless to seek a difference. This is the meaning.

original: tha mi dad pa nyid brjod pa ni /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa nyid brjod pa ni /
translated: The statement of nondifference is:

original: mig las ldog pa ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: mig las ldog pa ces bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe reversal from the eye.‚Äù

original: mngar po ma yin pa las ldog pa'i bu ram gyi don bya ba thob pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mngar po ma yin pa las ldog pa'i bu ram gyi don bya ba thob pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the function of sugar is obtained through the reversal from what is not sweet,

original: mngar ba tha dad pa las don bya ba skye ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mngar ba tha dad pa las don bya ba skye ba ni ma yin no //
translated: the function does not arise from a different sweetness.

original: 'o na ci ltar chos tha dad pa yin snyam du dogs pa sel bas de 'bras bu can dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'chad pa ni chos kyi byed pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar chos tha dad pa yin snyam du dogs pa sel bas de 'bras bu can dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'chad pa ni chos kyi byed pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: To dispel the doubt, How then are they different phenomena? the explanation that which has that as its effect and that which does not have that as its effect is given, and the activity of a phenomenon and so forth.

original: de'i 'bras bu dang cig shos de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa ste de dag ldog mtshams yin te /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu dang cig shos de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa ste de dag ldog mtshams yin te /
translated: The effect of that and that which does not have that as its effect are the limits of the exclusion.

original: blo'i rnam pa gang la de rgyu mtshan du yod pa des brtags pa'o //
analyzed: blo'i rnam pa gang la de rgyu mtshan du yod pa des brtags pa'o //
translated: That which is the basis of a mental aspect is that which is imagined by that.

original: de zhes bya ba ni chos tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni chos tha dad pa'o //
translated: That is a different phenomenon.

original: de la ni de ltar gnas pas na'o //
analyzed: de la ni de ltar gnas pas na'o //
translated: It is in that way because it abides in that way.

original: 'o na mkhas pa dag tha dad pa rtogs pa la gus par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na mkhas pa dag tha dad pa rtogs pa la gus par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: If one thinks, Well then, the wise will be devoted to the realization of difference, [the root text] says, The wise are devoted to the realization of the suchness of things.

original: dngos po'i de kho na rtogs pa lhur byed pa zhes bya ba ste mkhas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po'i de kho na rtogs pa lhur byed pa zhes bya ba ste mkhas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The wise are devoted to the realization of the suchness of things, which is to say, they are devoted to the realization of the suchness of things.

original: rang rgyud nyid spong ba ni de skad du yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang rgyud nyid spong ba ni de skad du yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: To abandon the very autonomous [reasoning], [the root text] says, In that way...

original: dpyod pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: dpyod pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Analysis is discursive consciousness.

original: tha snyad ni mngon par brjod pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tha snyad ni mngon par brjod pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Convention is verbal expression and so on.

original: de dag gis ni 'jig rten pa'i lam gang yin pa der gnas pa na byis pa dang / mkhas pa dag rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa dang / brjod pa dag la bltos te 'dra ba nyid do //
analyzed: de dag gis ni 'jig rten pa'i lam gang yin pa der gnas pa na byis pa dang / mkhas pa dag rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa dang / brjod pa dag la bltos te 'dra ba nyid do //
translated: When abiding in the mundane path, the childish and the wise are similar in terms of conceptual cognition and verbal expression.

original: gang gi phyir de dang de las ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan can blo'i rnam pas brtags pa'i chos tha dad pa dag tha snyad pas rnam par dpyad par mi nus pa des na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dang de las ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan can blo'i rnam pas brtags pa'i chos tha dad pa dag tha snyad pas rnam par dpyad par mi nus pa des na'o //
translated: It is because conventional analysis cannot analyze the different phenomena that are imagined by the aspects of cognition, which have the characteristics of turning away from this and that.

original: de'i bdag nyid de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa 'ga' zhig las thob pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mthong ba'i lam du byed de /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa 'ga' zhig las thob pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mthong ba'i lam du byed de /
translated: The path of seeing is obtained from some connection, which has the characteristic of being of the nature of that or arising from that.

original: mthong ba la nye bar sbyor ro zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: mthong ba la nye bar sbyor ro zhes 'brel to //
translated: It is connected that one is brought to seeing.

original: gang gi phyir chos dang chos can gyi tha snyad 'di brtags pa yin pas na zhes bya ba ni skabs kyi mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos dang chos can gyi tha snyad 'di brtags pa yin pas na zhes bya ba ni skabs kyi mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: Because this convention of phenomena and subjects is imagined, this concludes the section.

original: ci'i phyir mi 'grub snyam na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi 'grub snyam na /
translated: If one wonders why it is not established,

original: yang nyid sgrub byed 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang nyid sgrub byed 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because it is the means of establishing the self.

original: gson po'i lus la bdag the tshom za ba ni @212b bum  pa la sogs pa la yang the tshom za bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gson po'i lus la bdag the tshom za ba ni @212b bum  pa la sogs pa la yang the tshom za bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: If one doubts the existence of the self in the living body, one will also doubt it in the pot, etc.

original: med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but not if it does not exist.

original: 'on te bum pa la ni med pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te bum pa la ni med pa yin te /
translated: But if it does not exist in the pot,

original: sangs rgyas pas khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pas khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because the Buddhist accepts it.

original: khas blangs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khas blangs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúaccepts‚Äù is supplied.

original: 'chad pa ni gson po'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'chad pa ni gson po'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúsays‚Äù refers to the living body.

original: 'on te yod dang med pa nyid du nges so zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te yod dang med pa nyid du nges so zhe na /
translated: But if it is certain that it exists or does not exist,

original: the tshom mi za ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: the tshom mi za ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then there is no doubt.

original: gzhan gyi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The word ‚Äúother‚Äù refers toüîΩthe pot, etc.

original: 'dod pa la sogs pa 'di dag ni 'ga' zhig la brten pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa la sogs pa 'di dag ni 'ga' zhig la brten pa yin te /
translated: These desires, etc. are based on something,

original: dngos po nyid yin pa na 'bras bur gyur pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: dngos po nyid yin pa na 'bras bur gyur pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: because they are effects, etc.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni khas blangs pas bum pa la sogs pa la bdag ldog pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni khas blangs pas bum pa la sogs pa la bdag ldog pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, because of the acceptance, the nonestablishment of the exclusion of the self from the pot, etc.

original: me las ldog pa med na yang zhes bya ba ni ci skad brjod pa'i tshul las med pa las ldog pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: me las ldog pa med na yang zhes bya ba ni ci skad brjod pa'i tshul las med pa las ldog pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: If there is no reversal from fire, then, as it is said, ‚Äúthere is no existence that is the reversal from nonexistence.‚Äù

original: med pa las ldog pa med par khas blangs kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: med pa las ldog pa med par khas blangs kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Even though one accepts that there is no reversal from nonexistence,

original: de la zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to life force, etc.

original: the tshom za bas na mi mthun pa'i phyogs la mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog par yang the tshom za ba yin no //
analyzed: the tshom za bas na mi mthun pa'i phyogs la mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog par yang the tshom za ba yin no //
translated: Since one is in doubt, one is also in doubt about the reversal from the discordant class.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni bdag ldog pas ldog par the tshom za bas na'o //üîΩde ltar sngar bkod pa'i rnam 'grel gyi phyed snga ma dang lhan cig 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rnam 'grel bshad nas /
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni bdag ldog pas ldog par the tshom za bas na'o // de ltar sngar bkod pa'i rnam 'grel gyi phyed snga ma dang lhan cig 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rnam 'grel bshad nas /
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means that because one is in doubt about the reversal through the reversal of the self,

original: phyed phyi ma bshad pa'i phyir gsungs pa ni gal te zhes bya pa'o //
analyzed: phyed phyi ma bshad pa'i phyir gsungs pa ni gal te zhes bya pa'o //
translated: thus, having explained the first half of the verse of the PramaÃÑnÔ¨Å ava together with the commentary, in order to explain the second half of the verse, it says, ‚ÄúIf one says . . .

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚Äù ‚ÄúThus‚Äù means

original: sangs rgyas pas khas blangs pa 'dod na'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pas khas blangs pa 'dod na'o //
translated: if one accepts the assertion of the Buddhist.

original: dogs pa ni sangs rgyas pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dogs pa ni sangs rgyas pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The doubt is expressed by ‚Äúbecause of the Buddha‚Äôs statement.‚Äù

original: lan ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is ‚ÄúWell then . . .‚Äù

original: de nyid do zhes bya ba ni tshad ma ma yin no zhes brjod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid do zhes bya ba ni tshad ma ma yin no zhes brjod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat itself‚Äù refers to what was said, ‚Äúit is not a valid cognition.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir de ltar srog la sogs pa gzhan las ldog par ma grub pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar srog la sogs pa gzhan las ldog par ma grub pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason is ‚Äúbecause in that way, life force, etc., are not established as different.‚Äù

original: bdag dang bcas pa gcig la nges par grub pa yin na /
analyzed: bdag dang bcas pa gcig la nges par grub pa yin na /
translated: If it is definitely established in one that has a self,

original: gzhan bdag med pa las ldog pa grub bo //
analyzed: gzhan bdag med pa las ldog pa grub bo //
translated: then it is established as the opposite of that which is without a self.

original: gal te bdag dang bcas pa dang bdag med pa'i phung po gnyis kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te bdag dang bcas pa dang bdag med pa'i phung po gnyis kho na ma yin nam /
translated: ‚ÄúBut aren‚Äôt there only two kinds of aggregates, those that have a self and those that are without a self?

original: des na gang gi tshe bdag med pa 'ga' zhig las ldog par mthong ba de'i tshe don gyi srog la sogs pa bdag dang bcas pa kho na la nges kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ni yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na gang gi tshe bdag med pa 'ga' zhig las ldog par mthong ba de'i tshe don gyi srog la sogs pa bdag dang bcas pa kho na la nges kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ni yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, when one sees the opposite of something that is without a self, at that time it is definitely only in those that have a self, such as life force, etc., and not in the opposite.‚Äù

original: ma mthong ba yin yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma mthong ba yin yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is ‚ÄúEven though it is not seen . . .‚Äù

original: gal te yang phung po gnyis yod pa las bum pa la sogs pa /
analyzed: gal te yang phung po gnyis yod pa las bum pa la sogs pa /
translated: ‚ÄúIf there are only two kinds of aggregates, those that have a self and those that are without a self,

original: bdag med pa 'ga' zhig la srog la sogs pa ma mthong ba de lta na yang mthong ba med pa'i @213a * //
analyzed: bdag med pa 'ga' zhig la srog la sogs pa ma mthong ba de lta na yang mthong ba med pa'i @213a * //
translated: Even though one does not see life, etc. in some non-self, still, one should not doubt that life, etc. are in the non-self, because the non-self is not the non-existence of life, etc.

original: bdag med pa la srog la sogs pa the tshom du 'gyur de bdag med pa yang yin la /üîΩsrog la sogs pa mi ldog pa yang min no zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: bdag med pa la srog la sogs pa the tshom du 'gyur de bdag med pa yang yin la / srog la sogs pa mi ldog pa yang min no zhes bya bar ro //
translated: If one does not see life, etc. in a self, still, one should not doubt that life, etc. are in the self, because the self is not the non-existence of life, etc.üîΩIf one does not see life, etc. in a self, still, one should not doubt that life, etc. are in the self, because the self is not the non-existence of life, etc.

original: gal te re zhig bum pa la sogs pa mthong ba dag la mthong bas bdag med par grub pa ma yin na ma zhe na /üîΩmthong ba yin yang zhes bya ba'o //üîΩre zhig bum pa la sogs pa la bdag med par ma grub mod kyi khas blangs nas kyang brjod pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te re zhig bum pa la sogs pa mthong ba dag la mthong bas bdag med par grub pa ma yin na ma zhe na / mthong ba yin yang zhes bya ba'o // re zhig bum pa la sogs pa la bdag med par ma grub mod kyi khas blangs nas kyang brjod pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If, on the one hand, the non-existence of a self is not established by the seeing of pots, etc., then, on the other hand, the non-existence of a self is not established by the non-seeing of life, etc.üîΩEven though one sees pots, etc., still, one should not doubt that they have a self, because the pots, etc. are not the non-existence of a self.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni srog la sogs pa rnams so //üîΩmi mthun pa'i phyogs las zhes bya ba ni yul la sogs pas bskal pa las so //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni srog la sogs pa rnams so // mi mthun pa'i phyogs las zhes bya ba ni yul la sogs pas bskal pa las so //
translated: Even though one does not see life, etc. in a self, still, one should not doubt that life, etc. are in the self, because the self is not the non-existence of life, etc.üîΩIf, on the one hand, the non-existence of a self is not established by the seeing of pots, etc., then, on the other hand, the non-existence of a self is not established by the non-seeing of life, etc.

original: mi mthun pa'i sogs las zhes mthong ba'i bum pa la sogs pa las so //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i sogs las zhes mthong ba'i bum pa la sogs pa las so //
translated: If, on the one hand, the non-existence of a self is not established by the seeing of pots, etc., then, on the other hand, the non-existence of a self is not established by the non-seeing of life, etc.

original: 'on te gang du ldog pa mthong ba der med mod /
analyzed: 'on te gang du ldog pa mthong ba der med mod /
translated: But if you see that it is reversed, then it is not there.

original: yul la sogs pas bskal pa gzhan la go ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: yul la sogs pas bskal pa gzhan la go ci ltar zhe na /
translated: But if it is seen to be absent where it is seen to be absent, then how can it be present in another place, another time, or another world?üîΩThe answer is:

original: bdag med ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag med ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because of the absence of self.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: phyed ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyed ces bya ba'o //
translated: Because of the absence of self.

original: 'o na ci ltar rigs she na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar rigs she na /
translated: But how can that be reasonable?

original: gcig gi ngo bor nges pa nyid du zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gcig gi ngo bor nges pa nyid du zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because of the certainty of the nature of one.

original: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba'i bdag med pa thams cad gcig nyid kho nar srog la sogs pa dang bral bar ro //
analyzed: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba'i bdag med pa thams cad gcig nyid kho nar srog la sogs pa dang bral bar ro //
translated: The absence of self is the same in all cases, whether it is seen or not, and it is free from life and so on.

original: des na gang cung zad bdag med pa de mtha' dag ni srog la sogs pa dang bral ba'o zhes bya bar grub po zhe na /
analyzed: des na gang cung zad bdag med pa de mtha' dag ni srog la sogs pa dang bral ba'o zhes bya bar grub po zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is established that whatever is the absence of self is free from life and so on.

original: gsal ba zhes bya ba ni /üîΩmkhregs pa'i gsal ba mtha' dag la khyab par byed pa ma yin yang /
analyzed: gsal ba zhes bya ba ni / mkhregs pa'i gsal ba mtha' dag la khyab par byed pa ma yin yang /
translated: The answer is:üîΩbecause of the manifestation of the nature of one.

original: mkhregs pa'i rigs can du gyur pa'i srog la sogs pa'i don yod de /
analyzed: mkhregs pa'i rigs can du gyur pa'i srog la sogs pa'i don yod de /
translated: Although the manifestation of solidity does not pervade all things, the meaning of life and so on is included in the class of the solid.

original: des na bdag med pa 'ga' zhig la srog la sogs pa ma mthong ba tsam gyis ni bdag ma nges pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na bdag med pa 'ga' zhig la srog la sogs pa ma mthong ba tsam gyis ni bdag ma nges pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the self is not ascertained to be nonexistent merely by not seeing life force, etc. in some nonself.

original: dper na mkhregs pa nyid mtshon gyis mi chod pa la nges pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mkhregs pa nyid mtshon gyis mi chod pa la nges pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, hardness is not ascertained to be unsevered by a weapon.

original: ci'i phyir 'ga' zhig la ma mthong pas nges ba mi 'grub ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'ga' zhig la ma mthong pas nges ba mi 'grub ce na /
translated: Why is ascertainment not established by not seeing in some?

original: yod la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yod la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because of existence.

original: bdag med pa 'ga' zhig la srog la sogs pa yod par the tshom za ba gang las ldog par 'gyur /
analyzed: bdag med pa 'ga' zhig la srog la sogs pa yod par the tshom za ba gang las ldog par 'gyur /
translated: From what is there reversal of doubt that life force, etc. exist in some nonself?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: bdag med pa dang srog la sogs pa la 'gal ba rnam pa gnyi ga yang ma mthong ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: bdag med pa dang srog la sogs pa la 'gal ba rnam pa gnyi ga yang ma mthong ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because both alternatives of contradiction between nonself and life force, etc. are not seen.

original: / bdag gal te bdag med pa gcig srog la sogs pa dang bral ba mthong na gzhan de las bzlog par ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: / bdag gal te bdag med pa gcig srog la sogs pa dang bral ba mthong na gzhan de las bzlog par ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the self were seen to be devoid of life force, etc. in some nonself, how could the other be the opposite of that?

original: gang gis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because of what?

original: 'ga' zhig ni gson po'i lus so //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ni gson po'i lus so //
translated: Some is the living body.

original: gzhan ni bum pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni bum pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Other is the pot, etc.

original: de lta ma yin par zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa dang mi ldan par @213b ro ;
analyzed: de lta ma yin par zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa dang mi ldan par @213b ro ;
translated: Otherwise, i.e., if the self were not endowed with life, etc.,

original: /'ga' zhig ni shing ngo //
analyzed: /'ga' zhig ni shing ngo //
translated: some would be trees,

original: gzhan ni rdo rje'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni rdo rje'o //
translated: others would be rocks,

original: gzhan du ni mtshon gyis mi chod pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du ni mtshon gyis mi chod pa'o //
translated: and others would be impervious to weapons.

original: ci ltar nges pa med ce na /
analyzed: ci ltar nges pa med ce na /
translated: How is it that there is no certainty?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: As it is said,

original: 'chad pa ni bdag med pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'chad pa ni bdag med pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe self is not perceived by any of the means of valid knowledge.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir de ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar yin zhe na /
translated: Why is that so?

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ste 'gal bas so //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ste 'gal bas so //
translated: Because of the contradiction, i.e., because of the contradiction between the self and the means of valid knowledge.

original: de ni bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: de ni bdag med pa'o //
translated: That is the selflessness.

original: la lar ni bdag la srog la sogs pa de'o //
analyzed: la lar ni bdag la srog la sogs pa de'o //
translated: In some places, the self is life, etc.

original: nges pa las gzhan bdag med pa dang 'gal ba ci yod //
analyzed: nges pa las gzhan bdag med pa dang 'gal ba ci yod //
translated: What is the contradiction between the self and selflessness?

original: bdag la nges pa kho nas so //
analyzed: bdag la nges pa kho nas so //
translated: The self is only certain.

original: bdag med pa dang 'gal ba yin na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag med pa dang 'gal ba yin na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is contradictory to selflessness.

original: de lta yin mod snyam na /üîΩnges pa de yang bdag gi 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: de lta yin mod snyam na / nges pa de yang bdag gi 'bras bu'am /
translated: If that is so,

original: bdag gi rang bzhin gyis yin par 'gyur te gzhan du nges pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag gi rang bzhin gyis yin par 'gyur te gzhan du nges pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then that certainty would be the result of the self or it would be the nature of the self, because certainty is not tenable in any other way.

original: srog la sogs pa ni de gnyis yin par tshad mas grub pa yang ma yin pa des na /
analyzed: srog la sogs pa ni de gnyis yin par tshad mas grub pa yang ma yin pa des na /
translated: Life force, etc. are not established by a valid cognition as those two.

original: ci ltar brgyud pas kyang 'gal /
analyzed: ci ltar brgyud pas kyang 'gal /
translated: How could there be a contradiction even indirectly?

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù is explained as follows.

original: khyad par byed pa zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa'i khyab par byed pa bdag yin la de dang bdag med pa 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par byed pa zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa'i khyab par byed pa bdag yin la de dang bdag med pa 'gal ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe pervader‚Äù is the self that pervades life force, etc. and that is incompatible with the absence of self.

original: khyab par bya ba dang yang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khyab par bya ba dang yang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThe pervaded‚Äù is

original: srog la sogs pa dang yang ngo /
analyzed: srog la sogs pa dang yang ngo /
translated: life force, etc.

original: 'on te bdag la nges pa yod pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te bdag la nges pa yod pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: But if there is a self, it is certain.

original: srog la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba ni ldan pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas so //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba ni ldan pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúLife force, etc.‚Äù is in the manner of being a possessor, etc.

original: 'on te srog la sogs pa ni bdag la de'i bdag nyid la sogs yin pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te srog la sogs pa ni bdag la de'i bdag nyid la sogs yin pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: But if life force, etc. are of the nature of the self, etc.

original: srog la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúLife force, etc.‚Äù

original: des na srog la sogs pa ni bdag med pa zlog par byed pa nyid ma yin no zhes gnas so //
analyzed: des na srog la sogs pa ni bdag med pa zlog par byed pa nyid ma yin no zhes gnas so //
translated: Therefore, life force, etc. are not the refuters of the absence of self.

original: 'di dag ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa yang ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'di dag ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa yang ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: It is not the case that these are also turned away from the discordant class.

original: des na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is said by ‚Äútherefore.‚Äù

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa'i /
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa'i /
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù refers to the life faculty, etc.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: der zhes bya ba ste bdag la'o //üîΩ'di nyid kyi phyir phung po gnyis las gcig la ni /üîΩnges par grub na gzhan las ni /
analyzed: der zhes bya ba ste bdag la'o // 'di nyid kyi phyir phung po gnyis las gcig la ni / nges par grub na gzhan las ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThere,‚Äù in the self.

original: ldog pa 'grub ces bshad pa yin no //üîΩmi mthun pa'i phyogs las srog la sogs pa ldog tu chug pa de lta na yang bdag med pa med pa'i rgyu las ni /
analyzed: ldog pa 'grub ces bshad pa yin no // mi mthun pa'i phyogs las srog la sogs pa ldog tu chug pa de lta na yang bdag med pa med pa'i rgyu las ni /
translated: For this very reason, it is explained that ‚Äúif one is established in one of the two classes, the other is established as turned away.‚Äù

original: gson po'i lus la bdag mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: gson po'i lus la bdag mi 'grub bo //
translated: Even if it is granted that life faculty, etc. are turned away from the discordant class, still, the self is not established in the living body, because of the absence of a cause.

original: rgyu gang gis na rigs pa can de ni ldog pa med pa dngos por 'dod pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: rgyu gang gis na rigs pa can de ni ldog pa med pa dngos por 'dod pa ma yin pas so //
translated: By what cause? Because the NaiyƒÅyika does not assert that it is a thing that is not turned away.

original: dper na srog la sogs pa mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa med kyang mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa yin par 'dod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na srog la sogs pa mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa med kyang mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa yin par 'dod pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, although life faculty, etc. are not turned away from the concordant class, they are asserted to exist in the concordant class.

original: gson po'i lus @214a * //
analyzed: gson po'i lus @214a * //
translated: In the same way, the self is not established in the living body,üîΩbecause of the absence of a cause.

original: la bdag med pa med kyang bdag yod par ni mi 'dod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: la bdag med pa med kyang bdag yod par ni mi 'dod par mi bya'o //
translated: But it should not be maintained that the self exists even though the selflessness of the self does not exist.

original: de'i phyir gal te gtan tshigs srog la sogs pa mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa med par 'dod na /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te gtan tshigs srog la sogs pa mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa med par 'dod na /
translated: Therefore, if you maintain that the reason, life force, etc., does not revert from the similar class,

original: de'i cho mthun pa'i phyogs las mi ldog pa med pa'i gtan tshigs des na rgyu de gtan tshigs rjes su 'gro ba can du gyur bas ci ltar ldog pa can du brjod /
analyzed: de'i cho mthun pa'i phyogs las mi ldog pa med pa'i gtan tshigs des na rgyu de gtan tshigs rjes su 'gro ba can du gyur bas ci ltar ldog pa can du brjod /
translated: then, since that reason is concomitant with the reason, how can it be said to be nonconcomitant?

original: rjes 'gro can mi ldog pa min zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rjes 'gro can mi ldog pa min zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThe concomitant is not nonreverted‚Äù means

original: gal te mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs kyi ldog pa med kyang de la srog la sogs pa 'thad par khas mi len na /
analyzed: gal te mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs kyi ldog pa med kyang de la srog la sogs pa 'thad par khas mi len na /
translated: if, although the reason does not revert from the similar class, you do not accept that life force, etc., are tenable in that class,

original: de'i tshe gson po'i lus bdag med pa ma yin yang bdag dang bcas pa nyid du mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe gson po'i lus bdag med pa ma yin yang bdag dang bcas pa nyid du mi 'grub ste /
translated: then, although the living body is not selfless, it is not established as having a self,

original: ldog pa med kyang yod par khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldog pa med kyang yod par khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because, although it does not revert, you do not accept that it exists.

original: 'chad pa ni ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'chad pa ni ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe explanation‚Äù is ‚Äúhow?‚Äù

original: mthun pa'i phyogs med pa bdag med pa la /
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs med pa bdag med pa la /
translated: In the selfless, which is not the similar class,

original: srog la sogs pa med pa med kyang ngo //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa med pa med kyang ngo //
translated: although there is no life, etc.

original: ci ltar mi mthun pa nye bar bkod ce na /
analyzed: ci ltar mi mthun pa nye bar bkod ce na /
translated: How is the discordant example adduced?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Thus,

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la ni srog la sogs pa ldog pa med kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la ni srog la sogs pa ldog pa med kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: in the concordant example, although the life, etc. are not absent, they do not exist.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: mthun pa'i phyogs bdag dang bcas pa de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs bdag dang bcas pa de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the concordant example, the embodied being, does not exist.

original: med kyang ldog pa med na yod par ci ste mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: med kyang ldog pa med na yod par ci ste mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If, although it does not exist, it is not absent, why is it not existent?

original: med pa la ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: med pa la ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because of the non-existence of the non-existent.

original: 'o na bdag med pa med kyang bdag rtogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes dogs na gson po'i lus la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na bdag med pa med kyang bdag rtogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes dogs na gson po'i lus la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Now, if one doubts that the self is not realized although the non-self does not exist, he says: in the living body.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: gson po'i lus de yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gson po'i lus de yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the living body exists.
